commit_message:
Just reset the repo instead of trying to co files

We can just reset the repo instead of trying to checkout specific files.
This fix external repos which doesn't not have requirements.txt or
test-requirements.txt.

Closes-Bug: 1231334
Change-Id: Iab898f5e8a422cc0cbfe44839c938f22c7525fd8

commit_message:
Add friendly information for noauth usage

Currently if --os-token is not specified when --os-auth-strategy
is noauth, the console just print 'unknown auth strategy'. This
fix will check options for noauth as keystone and generate more
friendly information for end-user.

Fixes: Bug #1162932
Change-Id: I59fed284f805c09b0f0ded2001e9552016285365

commit_message:
Sync gettextutils from oslo-incubator

Module gettextutils is out of date and cannot support python3, since
upstream has been ported to python3, this sync is necessary.

Change-Id: I866119fd5bace405c10179854fc571e40e14b17e
Implements: blueprint py33-support

commit_message:
VMware: fix VM resize bug

The following operations would fail due to invalid references, either by name
or UUID:
    - resize
    - resize-confirm
    - resize-revert

Closes-bug: #1199954

Change-Id: I39b804ed3c0c57455547d9ece0ef779cf73a5926

subject: Install Guide: Fix bugs in block storage node
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-23 12:29:58.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_cinder-node.xml'], 'message': "Install Guide: Fix bugs in block storage node

* Fix misspelled pvcreate command
* storage node needs cinder database password
* tgtd.conf must include cinder volume configs (rhel;centos;fedora)
* lvm filter wouldn't work with the volume used

Change-Id: Iaa81520541e5b4d98601d81998e67322c069f91d
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1243671
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Install Guide: Fix bugs in block storage node

* Fix misspelled pvcreate command
* storage node needs cinder database password
* tgtd.conf must include cinder volume configs (rhel;centos;fedora)
* lvm filter wouldn't work with the volume used

Change-Id: Iaa81520541e5b4d98601d81998e67322c069f91d
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1243671

subject: Fix Misplaced Steps in OVS Setup
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-23 19:42:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix Misplaced Steps in OVS Setup

It would appear that some of the steps from the main Neutron setup
managed to find themselves in the OVS section.  This was rather
confusing to the reader, as the steps seemed to abruptly change
course in the OVS documentation, while the steps in the main Neutron
install guide seem to skip over discussing the plugin entirely.
This is now rectified.

Change-Id: I022f2a9061229f067057c1e386df0ca1f8942724
Fixes: bug #1243749
backport: havana

commit_message:
Fix Misplaced Steps in OVS Setup

It would appear that some of the steps from the main Neutron setup
managed to find themselves in the OVS section.  This was rather
confusing to the reader, as the steps seemed to abruptly change
course in the OVS documentation, while the steps in the main Neutron
install guide seem to skip over discussing the plugin entirely.
This is now rectified.

Change-Id: I022f2a9061229f067057c1e386df0ca1f8942724
Fixes: bug #1243749
backport: havana

commit_message:
feat: add shard management resource

This patchset adds a new resource that exposes shard registry through
the administrative API. Since there is no storage backend available
that implements this functionality yet, the shards resource is not
connected to the queues routes just yet.

Preliminary support is added for unit testing this soon.

Change-Id: I49793990327643fc2bc5091615fb0bebcef04bc0
Partially-implements: blueprint storage-sharding

commit_message:
Replace basestring by six for python3 compatability

The builtin basestring abstract type was removed in python3,
use str instead, we need to using six.string_types to replace
the basestring for python3 compatibility.

Partial Implements bp basestring-py3-compatible

Change-Id: I719e104ae46ebb6e986c53a019b93e3a45e6d0fd

subject: Fix consoleauth check_token for rpcapi v2
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 12:45:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix consoleauth check_token for rpcapi v2

In 48dd52095869d36970de232f5dfa60656fcd578b support for the 2.0
consoleauth rpc API was added which missed the return statement in the
check_token method. Because of this none of the components that had to
verify a token agains consoleauth component would fail to do so.

This patch fixes the check_token method and extends the tests to cover
the new v2.0 class.

commit_message:
Fix consoleauth check_token for rpcapi v2

In 48dd52095869d36970de232f5dfa60656fcd578b support for the 2.0
consoleauth rpc API was added which missed the return statement in the
check_token method. Because of this all the components that had to
verify a token against consoleauth component would fail to do so.

This patch fixes the check_token method and extends the tests to cover
the new v2.0 class.

Closes-Bug: #1244220
Change-Id: I4e5186943d28609083f723f4b43ab6f0ecbffd27

subject: require iso8601>=0.1.8
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-23 21:12:14.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'require iso8601>=0.1.8

0.1.8 supports a superset of the date formats supported in 0.1.4.
While in general this is great, it means that if we allow both, certain
usages will fail unpredictably. However, implementing either a backwards
compatible restriction on top of 0.1.8 or a forward-compatible extension
to 0.1.4 is ungainly and essentially reimplements the library. Hence, a
better course is to just advance the requirement to ensure uniformity.

Change-Id: I8fa317b30c7fb0cef83762da71f3bfc74c8847ae
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
require iso8601>=0.1.8

0.1.8 supports a superset of the date formats supported in 0.1.4.
While in general this is great, it means that if we allow both, certain
usages will fail unpredictably. However, implementing either a backwards
compatible restriction on top of 0.1.8 or a forward-compatible extension
to 0.1.4 is ungainly and essentially reimplements the library. Hence, a
better course is to just advance the requirement to ensure uniformity.

Change-Id: I8fa317b30c7fb0cef83762da71f3bfc74c8847ae

[{'created': '2013-10-09 18:12:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'feat: split queues API into public/admin

This change is made in prepartion for the upcoming sharded storage
features. Shard registration is a feature that only operators should
be able to do, and since the sharding is done within the queues
application, it was necessary to break this out into a separate API.

This patch also adopts the conventions used by the -proxy in order to
separate the API.

A few small refactorings were made, including:
- health resource moved to common transport location

application, it was necessary to break this out into a separate API.

This patch also adopts the conventions used by the -proxy in order to
separate the API.

A few small refactorings were made, including:
- health resource moved to common transport location
- version module moved to common/transport
- pass config from bootstrap to transport driver
- pass cache in base transport driver
- convert base transport driver to use six.add_metaclass
- pass public bootstrap to bootstrap unit test

Change-Id: I0d6ff381afb25adb8a4b784a60b6d6eb71431245

commit_message:
feat: split queues API into public/admin

This change is made in prepartion for the upcoming sharded storage
features. Shard registration is a feature that only operators should
be able to do, and since the sharding is done within the queues
application, it was necessary to break this out into a separate API.

This patch adds a new configuration variable: admin_mode. It is used
to multiplex which version of the API is loaded. Furthermore, the
admin API is an enhanced version of the public API in that it allows
every route that the public API in addition to admin-only
endpoints. This should ease unit testing in future patches.

A few small refactorings were made, including:
- health resource moved to common transport location
- version module moved to common/transport
- pass config from bootstrap to transport driver
- pass cache in base transport driver
- convert base transport driver to use six.add_metaclass
- pass public bootstrap to bootstrap unit test

Change-Id: I0d6ff381afb25adb8a4b784a60b6d6eb71431245
Partially-implements: blueprint storage-sharding

commit_message:
To make glance compatible with both iso8601 0.1.4 and >=0.1.7

Enhance glance-{api,registry} to provide consistent image query result
with iso8601 0.1.4 or >=0.1.7 development.

iso8601 0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle datestring param
which missing the time part like "YYYY-MM-DD", "YYYYMMDD" and etc.
style. This behavior is different than iso8601-0.1.4, so caused
glance-{api,registry}'s v1 API controller provide different result.

Fixes bug: 1242501

Change-Id: I6fa67b46c256179ab1422bf6b81dba5bb9b0a164
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

subject: Adopt 0.1.8 as iso8601 minimum version
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 10:26:23.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Adopt 0.1.8 as iso8601 minimum version

In the images api, we depend on iso8601 to parse some dates and times.
Recently, since version 0.1.4, python-iso8601 added support for a few
more formats, and we finally got some other issues nailed down by 0.1.8.
If end user switch from 0.1.8 back to 0.1.4 in the deployment, the image
api will lose support for certain datetime formats like YYYY-MM-DD
(where the time part is assumed to be all zeros). This obviously creates
a compatibility concern.

We were resolved to make glance compatible with both iso 0.1.4 and
0.1.8, but it appears that to do so requires essentially reimplementing
a large swath of iso8601 0.1.8 in glance itself.

Fixes bug: 1242501

Change-Id: Iece0116d3c412216251e2d7fbffe10bfe2c1c789
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Adopt 0.1.8 as iso8601 minimum version

In the images api, we depend on iso8601 to parse some dates and times.
Recently, since version 0.1.4, python-iso8601 added support for a few
more formats, and we finally got some other issues nailed down by 0.1.8.
If end user switch from 0.1.8 back to 0.1.4 in the deployment, the image
api will lose support for certain datetime formats like YYYY-MM-DD
(where the time part is assumed to be all zeros). This obviously creates
a compatibility concern.

We were resolved to make glance compatible with both iso 0.1.4 and
0.1.8, but it appears that to do so requires essentially reimplementing
a large swath of iso8601 0.1.8 in glance itself.

Fixes bug: 1242501

Change-Id: Iece0116d3c412216251e2d7fbffe10bfe2c1c789
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Guess the group name for Lazily registered options

securemessage.py for example lazily registers options into the
'secure_messages' group. Current code in generator assumes that all
registration is done on the global CONF. In this review, we relax
that a bit and looks if there is only and only one OptGroup is
in the module as well and assumes that there would be a lazy
registration of the options into that OptGroup sometime later.

Change-Id: I8aaa1267e32fd1080318031945fd0f7594bd6250
Closes-Bug: 1241720

commit_message:
Externalisation of heat template

Reasons: preparing trove to support multidatastores
Changes: template loading, heat-support update
This code piece refactors the earlier code of instance creation
using heat.

Heat templates are stored in /etc/trove/heat_templates/.

For each service type we have a unique template file
<service_type>.heat.template

Author: Nilakhya Chatterjee (SnowDust) <nilakhya@globallogic.com>
Co-Authored-By: Denis Makogon (dmakogon) <dmakogon@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I01996f120df0780da2f831c2e8962e51b1498a59
Implements: blueprint provide-custom-heat-templates-for-each-service-in-trove

commit_message:
Check and generate pub ssh key

There are some situations where ~/.ssh would exist but without
keys (ssh from a new box and generating a .ssh/known_hosts).
Now we check for the existence of key and not the folder.

Closes-Bug: #1240133

Change-Id: I1565fbf96c53d0c43db02781b15fb15c26757b08

subject: Enable different tenants in the scenario runner
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-23 20:35:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable different tenants in the scenario runner

The current implementation of the scenario runner runs all the benchmark
scenarios from the admin account returned in the endpoints config from the
deploy engine. It uses thus only one tenant and one user to emulate all the
load on the cloud which is a bit unrealistic.

This patch allows the user to add "tenants" and "users_per_tenant" parameters
to the test config. The scenario runner then creates the necessary amount of
temporary tenants and users and uses them randomly while executing benchmark
scenarios.

Blueprint test-engine

Change-Id: I5a85a344ed73242d5b33f7af88e222c049f95dd4
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-23 20:40:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable different tenants in the scenario runner

scenarios from the admin account returned in the endpoints config from the
deploy engine. It uses thus only one tenant and one user to emulate all the
load on the cloud which is a bit unrealistic.

This patch allows the user to add "tenants" and "users_per_tenant" parameters
to the test config, like:

"NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server": [
 {"args": {"flavor_id": 1,

  "times": 10, "concurrent": 2,
  "tenants": 3, "users_per_tenant": 2}
]

The scenario runner then creates the necessary amount of temporary tenants and
users and uses them randomly while executing benchmark scenarios.

Blueprint test-engine

commit_message:
Enable different tenants in the scenario runner

The current implementation of the scenario runner runs all the benchmark
scenarios from the admin account returned in the endpoints config from the
deploy engine. It uses thus only one tenant and one user to emulate all the
load on the cloud which is a bit unrealistic.

This patch allows the user to add "tenants" and "users_per_tenant" parameters
to the test config, like:

"NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server": [
 {"args": {"flavor_id": 1,
           "image_id": "73257560-c59b-4275-a1ec-ab140e5b9979"},
  "times": 10, "concurrent": 2,
  "tenants": 3, "users_per_tenant": 2}
]

The scenario runner then creates the necessary amount of temporary tenants and
users and uses them randomly while executing benchmark scenarios.

Blueprint test-engine

Change-Id: I5a85a344ed73242d5b33f7af88e222c049f95dd4

commit_message:
Fix to support ipv6 in sql connection urls

sqlalchemy has trouble with ipv6 urls, so we should parse
the url ourselves before we call sqlalchemy.create_engine.
The regexp can get us part of the way and we can use the
parse_host_port method to extract the host and port.
Added a bunch of tests with sample urls found in the
logs and our code base.

Change-Id: I4bb3a23dee70e33b2bd931eb203b7d12617f2849
Closes-Bug: 1190454

commit_message:
Move auth-system mechanism from novaclient.

- Move auth system plugin mechanism from novaclient to keystoneclient.
- Remove the old auth system way.
- Dummy plugin available here http://goo.gl/Ngzst
- Interface changed a bit from what we used in novaclient authenticate
  method signature should be (**kwargs was added):
    authenticate(self, cls, auth_url, **kwargs)

Change-Id: Ia7b020aa5556240eb3a33287ac74198ecc17b382

subject: Fully initialize the keystone client in osclients
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-23 10:26:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fully initialize the keystone client in osclients

To be able to perform some administrative tasks like listing/creating tenants
etc., the keystone client needs to use a public address which is not guaranteed
in case of using the "auth_url" parameter only. This patch adds the "endpoint"
parameter to the input of the keystone client constructor + authenticates the
client on this URL so that it gets fully functional.

Change-Id: I50ef23d4f916de8596aa2fea6f1babdb7742798f
Closes-Bug: #1243273
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-23 10:34:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fully initialize the keystone client in osclients

To be able to perform some administrative tasks like listing/creating tenants
etc., the keystone client needs to use a public address which is not guaranteed
in case of using the "auth_url" parameter only. This patch adds the "endpoint"
parameter to the input of the keystone client constructor + authenticates the
client on this URL so that it gets fully functional.

commit_message:
Fully initialize the keystone client in osclients

To be able to perform some administrative tasks like listing/creating tenants
etc., the keystone client needs to use a public address which is not guaranteed
in case of using the "auth_url" parameter only. This patch adds the "endpoint"
parameter to the input of the keystone client constructor + authenticates the
client on this URL so that it gets fully functional.

Change-Id: I50ef23d4f916de8596aa2fea6f1babdb7742798f
Closes-Bug: #1243273

commit_message:
Fix local test case failure for test_lxc_install()

test_lxc_install() testcase eventually fails while running on a local machine
because of a path string issue. This patch fixes this by using os.path.abspath.

Change-Id: I9507469f725772a41378379bf23cbaae1741dcea

commit_message:
Drop RPC securemessage.py and crypto module.

As of 579109cab946a54f86b04724f0b6cb71fb027c04 Nova should
have the openstack common crypto modules to support
rpc/securemessage.

The RPC securemessage stuff will eventually get integrated into
oslo.message. As is it is only partially complete in oslo-incubator
and it is getting synced into various projects (and breaking
some things).

This commit drops securemessage.py which was missing classes in
the crypto module anyway and would not have worked.

Closes-bug #1241634

Change-Id: I050d620a51042007aa4696fa439bd99c7597a9a4

commit_message:
Reply with a meaningful exception, when libvirt connection is broken.

Libvirt driver will respond with a meaningful error on any
command, when the connection to the libvirt service is broken.

Closes-bug: #1240344
Change-Id: I823fefaffcf969ecf9eb853ac99dc18cef92d137

commit_message:
Rename "rtstool" to "cinder-rtstool", add dep

With rtstool merged into Cinder, it should use the
"cinder-" prefix.

Add to setup.cfg scripts section for installation.

Additionally, add the rtslib-fb>=2.1.39 dependency
to Cinder's runtime requirements.

Implements blueprint: lio-rtslib

Change-Id: I715db09cb86145c6769c345f59ecda4d18b5e659

commit_message:
VMware: fix bug for reporting instance UUID's

Ensure that the correct UUID's are reported to the compute
manager. The fix will return only valid UUID's and not all
of the names of the instances running.

Closes-Bug: #1237795

Change-Id: I32bb6f4783dcc80697abebd5a7f45ef9950a0896

commit_message:
Install Guide: Don't use obsolete sql_connection

For neutron and ceilometer, sql_connection is deprecated use
instead:
[database]
connection

Fixes some wrong format connection strings.

Also, reconnect_interval is deprecated in favor of retry_interval

Cherry-Pick: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52832/
Change-Id: Ieb72349bafcbd1795d64f832d64fdbce695147bf
Backport: stable/havana
Partial-Bug: #1243131
Closes-Bug: #1205060

commit_message:
Fix divergence in attach_interfaces extensions

I pointed out in revision 7 of Ibe4cbd025700aa0d73a6d4d19fbf8f0005509428
that it we shouldn't use a different variable name in the identical code
shared between the v3 and v2 extensions, but that was never fixed before
merging.

Change-Id: I7c2853db2cbad30a37efd98947ebe687b37bfbe8

commit_message:
Add email format validation by jsonschema

This patch adds email format validation by using jsonschema to ensure
there is at least a '@' in the email address.

Fixes bug  #1218682

Change-Id: I03f16eff723a21855fc81c102be0d81c2123208c

subject: Set OVS/enable_tunneling in the plugin, not only the agent
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 09:18:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Set OVS/enable_tunneling in the plugin, not only the agent

It is wrong to assume (as the commit
8d0d9f3a4275649747cc50648f129c92e286def3 did) that that any node that
runs the OVS plugin will also run the corresponding plugin-specific
agent. It is perfectly feasible and supported to have an API node that
loads the OVS plugin, and which is distinct from compute and network
nodes that run the plugin-specific agent. If Neutron is configured for
GRE tunneling, then the API node (which runs the plugin), and the
network node and compute node (which run the agent) must all be
configured for tunneling.

Use ensure_resource to enable tunneling, regardless of whether the
plugin and agent nodes are separate or not.

Failure to enable tunneling on the node running neutron-server, while
setting $tenant_network_type = 'gre', will result in the following
error and render the Neutron API service inoperational:

ERROR neutron.plugins.openvswitch.ovs_neutron_plugin [-] Tunneling disabled but tenant_network_type is 'gre'. Server terminated!

Change-Id: Ia30d27d2f18670bd843dfe14decff6ce4728ba07
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-16 09:25:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Set OVS/enable_tunneling in the plugin, not only the agent

commit_message:
Set OVS/enable_tunneling in the plugin, not only the agent

It is wrong to assume (as the commit
8d0d9f3a4275649747cc50648f129c92e286def3 did) that that any node that
runs the OVS plugin will also run the corresponding plugin-specific
agent. It is perfectly feasible and supported to have an API node that
loads the OVS plugin, and which is distinct from compute and network
nodes that run the plugin-specific agent. If Neutron is configured for
GRE tunneling, then the API node (which runs the plugin), and the
network node and compute node (which run the agent) must all be
configured for tunneling.

Use ensure_resource to enable tunneling, regardless of whether the
plugin and agent nodes are separate or not.

Failure to enable tunneling on the node running neutron-server, while
setting $tenant_network_type = 'gre', will result in the following
error and render the Neutron API service inoperational:

ERROR neutron.plugins.openvswitch.ovs_neutron_plugin [-] Tunneling disabled but tenant_network_type is 'gre'. Server terminated!

Change-Id: Ia30d27d2f18670bd843dfe14decff6ce4728ba07

commit_message:
add new options to config vnc/spice server

current whether to start vnc/spice server depends on n-novnc/n-xvnc or
n-spice service which will make we can not access the virtual machine
on compute node where we do not start n-novnc/n-xvnc or n-spice service.
I add two options VNC_ENABLED and SPICE_ENABLED to config whether we
need to start vnc/spice server.

fixes bug 1211640

Change-Id: Id7fbb2425873676065bc41003bced12b61a83c3c

commit_message:
Make samples optional

This patch makes it possible to turn off the sample plugins
and decouples the AMQP consumer configuration for the collector
from the sample plugins. This will make it easier to stand up
different types of notification processing in the future.

Change-Id: I10a0e54510b532d8e948e372078278dbf011f06c
Related-To: blueprint notification-pipelines

commit_message:
Add ipmi inspector

With this extension it is possible to get data out of a IPMI interface. It collects temperature, fan's speed, voltage and system log information. It depends on blueprint "bp/monitoring-physical-devices" (Id259b95efdbf0b7d03b657586d588f9637d9a367)

blueprint bp/ipmi-inspector-for-monitoring-physical-devices

Change-Id: I423466a777e782c29aa236aa7aa94692f472706f

commit_message:
Additional variable APACHE_SERVER_NAME added

It specifies the server name for apache's virtual host.
Helpful if you use apache for other applications too.

Additionally: moved configuration to configure_horizon,
removed the code modifying localrc, changed the code
according to other comments.

UPD: moved code back to init_horizon
UPD2: rebased
Change-Id: Ia8969b0a291a6f10db1508087723d92fd08b84ce

commit_message:
Add unsafe flag to libvirt live migration call.

This patch add a new option 'libvirt_migrate_unsafe' which
tells to libvirt to use the flag VIR_MIGRATE_UNSAFE when
doing live migration.

This flag permits to force libvirt to live migrate an instance
even if the underlying hypervisor is caching the IOs, this make
sense if it use a clustered storage.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I95e48c7a896ff8f86a132f3f32414060431b74c8
Fixes: bug #1222682

commit_message:
Metric plugin support

Provide a means to tap into the hypervisor and guest metrics
frequently polled by the compute nodes. This allows us to
push monitoring logic to the edge vs. flooding the network
with samples.

Implements: blueprint host-metric-hook

Change-Id: Id3ee112ccdf632f255e0b97d739c1ab5153596c4

commit_message:
Setup logdir with adm group permissions

Current Ubuntu packages for nova setup nova:adm for /var/log/nova,
puppet would override the permissions to nova:nova.  This patch restores
the native functionality.

Change-Id: I39de8e0ccb6e40a1da4df168c4468c36e1009162
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <paul.belanger@polybeacon.com>

subject: Replace getsitepackages with more portable method
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-11 14:55:28.000000000', 'files': ['tools/fixup_stuff.sh'], 'message': 'Replace getsitepackages with more portable method

Python 2.6 doesn't have a site.getsitepackages() call. Instead, this
method gets the path of the python file loaded by "import" and uses
that directory as the site-packages location.

Closes-Bug: 1238707
Change-Id: Ic10d890e7612cd9c6fb4b14ed51588ef1f1c93c5
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Replace getsitepackages with more portable method

Python 2.6 doesn't have a site.getsitepackages() call. Instead, this
method gets the path of the python file loaded by "import" and uses
that directory as the site-packages location.

Closes-Bug: 1238707
Change-Id: Ic10d890e7612cd9c6fb4b14ed51588ef1f1c93c5

commit_message:
Don't use EncryptedKeyring backend use PlaintextKeyring instead

If EncryptedKeyring, there is no long running keyring and a
password is required every time novaclient is run. But we already
keep the keystone password in a plaintext file so this results
in worse usability and no extra security.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ib0ccaf5517e1bbdf723748dbc192d2565f5780fc

commit_message:
Further harden boto version checking in EC2 tests

Use pkg_resources to also construct the boto version we are interested
in, instead of our own tuples.

Fixes bug: 1239890

Change-Id: I348021fd62f9d9341cae6f639c6d998a245f9e7f

commit_message:
change assertEquals to assertEqual

According to http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html
assertEquals is a deprecated alias of assertEqual.

Change-Id: Ie8844b183c301e9a4a9a4579e1e165c30550a0c7

I am getting a lot of http 404's from Fedora mirrors, in particular in
the US. Alternatively we could get cache-url to use previously existing

", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Allow for bad Fedora image mirrors

I am getting a lot of http 404's from Fedora mirrors, in particular in
the US. Alternatively we could get cache-url to use previously existing
files if they exist and there is an error but this may not be the
correct thing todo in all cases.

So for now we do a retry if HTTP 404 is returned to the request for a
Fedora image.

Change-Id: I7634aeac3bdfe6930fafe6d276186c09fc8587b5

commit_message:
Repeat Ceilometer alarm actions by default

The policy actions assume repeat_actions=true.

For the situation when cpu is high even when a new server is added.
Here we would expect yet-another server to be added but what currently
happens is the alarm will be stuck in the alarm state, but with no
further actions.

We need a default that it sane.

Closes-bug: #1242168
Related-bug: #1223347
Change-Id: I4c6a084076a0cc01ebd0d7431d3fac559161e947

commit_message:
Allow plugins to be specified as a cloud_backend

Currently, the cloud_backend configuration option can only use modules
imported in-tree before clients.py is imported. This does not work for
plugins because they are dynamically imported in
heat/engine/resources/__init__.py after clients.py is imported. Change
the cloud_backend module to be specified when the client class needs
to be initialized rather than when clients.py is imported. This change
requires a class to be specified for the cloud_backend rather than a
module name.

Change-Id: I8f2b93bfb6a9585d1e7dc52d70092105b6e1bfaa
Closes-Bug: 1242870

commit_message:
Add rebuild to OS::Nova::Server

Nova has support to rebuild an instance so that it keeps the same
instance id and address. This is particularly useful for doing image
based updates to servers without incurring additional cost to create new
servers and then delete the old ones.

We still default to replacing, and add a new policy called 'REBUILD' for
the times where we want a resource to be rebuilt on image updates rather
than replaced.

blueprint nova-server-rebuild

Change-Id: If0033f52912e939048b5ebc1ee2e30f67d225f34

subject: Refactor Nova server resizing to be self contained
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 18:45:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Refactor Nova server resizing to be self contained

The split between calling server.resize() and check_resize() makes it
more complicated to add other tasks that can be done in parallel with

commit_message:
Refactor Nova server resizing to be self contained

The split between calling server.resize() and check_resize() makes
it more complicated to add other tasks that can be done in parallel
with other servers' tasks. By making a resize method which is self
contained we simplify the addition of rebuild in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: I0490476dbef30571e90b88163fc8ca0670458682

subject: Check if dir exists before calling listdir
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 00:05:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/initiator/host_driver.py'], 'message': "Check if dir exists before calling listdir

Changes along the way to how we clean up and detach after
copying an image to a volume exposed a problem in the cleanup
of the brick/initiator routines.

The clean up in the initiator detach was doing a blind listdir
of /dev/disk/by-path, however due to detach and cleanup being
called upon completion of the image download to the volume if
there are no other devices mapped in this directory the directory
is removed.

The result was that even though the create and copy of the image
was succesful, the HostDriver code called os.lisdir on a directory
that doesn't exist any longer and raises an unhandled exception that
cause the taskflow mechanism to mark the volume as failed.

Change-Id: I488755c1a49a77f42efbb58a7a4eb6f4f084df07
Closes-bug: #1243980
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Check if dir exists before calling listdir

Changes along the way to how we clean up and detach after
copying an image to a volume exposed a problem in the cleanup
of the brick/initiator routines.

The clean up in the initiator detach was doing a blind listdir
of /dev/disk/by-path, however due to detach and cleanup being
called upon completion of the image download to the volume if
there are no other devices mapped in this directory the directory
is removed.

The result was that even though the create and copy of the image
was succesful, the HostDriver code called os.lisdir on a directory
that doesn't exist any longer and raises an unhandled exception that
cause the taskflow mechanism to mark the volume as failed.

Change-Id: I488755c1a49a77f42efbb58a7a4eb6f4f084df07
Closes-bug: #1243980

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-20 21:30:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Allow user_data to be in a cloud-init-free raw form

Although heat's agent tooling is heavily dependent on cloud-init, some
users will want to orchestrate servers that are not cloud-init enabled.
They may use their own agent, or a user_data which is executed as a
script on boot.

This change adds the property 'user_data_format' to OS::Nova::Server
with the available options 'CLOUD_INIT' or 'RAW'.

The following OS::Nova::Server resource snippet was successfully
executed on a cirros image (which does not support cloud-init)
      user_data_format: RAW
      user_data: |
        #!/bin/sh -v
        echo foo > /tmp/bar

This change is completely unrelated to any software configuration
related blueprints, however the property user_data_format has the
potential of supporting more values in the future.

Implements blueprint raw-user-data

Change-Id: I27571620b4fc74a9f82d12a2f754037c00ad81ff

commit_message:
Allow user_data to be passed without modification

Although heat's agent tooling is heavily dependent on cloud-init, some
users will want to orchestrate servers that are not cloud-init enabled.
They may use their own agent, or a user_data which is executed as a
script on boot. Possibly the user will also want to specify #cloud-config
user_data explicitly.

This change adds the property 'user_data_format' to OS::Nova::Server
with the available options 'HEAT_CFNTOOLS' or 'RAW'.

The following OS::Nova::Server resource snippet was successfully
executed on a cirros image (which does not support cloud-init)
      user_data_format: RAW
      user_data: |
        #!/bin/sh -v
        echo foo > /tmp/bar

This change is completely unrelated to any software configuration
related blueprints, however the property user_data_format has the
potential of supporting more values in the future.

Implements blueprint raw-user-data

Change-Id: I27571620b4fc74a9f82d12a2f754037c00ad81ff

Replace assertEquals with assertEqual

The method assertEquals has been deprecated since python 2.7.
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Also in Python 3, a deprecated warning is raised when using assertEquals.

commit_message:
Properly handle transport:///vhost URL

Currently, if we are supplied with a transport URL with only the virtual
host specified, we completely ignore it. Instead, the behaviour should
be that we use that virtual host with the host, port and credentials
from the config file.

Change-Id: Ic97aa511ddf9bce69b1a5069d9f6468f4bd6dd4c

and older version, within a compatibility window. So, if an object
had a revision that added or changed the formatting of an attribute,
the obj_make_compatible() method can fix up a primitive representation
before it is sent to a client expecting the older version.

This is primarily intended to be done by conductor when object(s)
are returned from classmethods by potentially-older compute nodes
with older object representations.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects

Change-Id: I95772e8d3290443c43e57955384ea4fc20b9dcce
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add obj_make_compatible()

This adds a method to NovaObject that allows it to convert itself to
and older version, within a compatibility window. So, if an object
had a revision that added or changed the formatting of an attribute,
the obj_make_compatible() method can fix up a primitive representation
before it is sent to a client expecting the older version.

This is primarily intended to be done by conductor when object(s)
are returned from classmethods by potentially-older compute nodes
with older object representations.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects

Change-Id: I95772e8d3290443c43e57955384ea4fc20b9dcce

commit_message:
Replace assert_ with assertTrue

The method assert_ has been deprecated since python 2.7.
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

This patch is a mere sed replace of one-liner assert_ to assertTrue.

grep -lR "assert_(" tests/* | \
xargs sed -ri 's/(\W+self.assert)_(\()(.+)(\)$)/\1True\2\3\4/'

Change-Id: Ic817bf32704adf2eb6ebbe67169625d65d49a9ad

commit_message:
Fix setting backdoor port in service start

Previously if self.manager wasn't defined for a Service object but a
backdoor_port was specified then that particular service would not
start because it would try to set the backdoor port in an object that
didn't exist. This commit fixes setting the backdoor port only if
manager is defined when calling start().

Closes-Bug: #1243260

Change-Id: Ib0e709cfd0e299a3e010450b7eba6e92bc108e4e

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 475, 'name': 'Rick Harris', 'email': 'rick.harris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'rconradharris'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 04:20:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/209_add_missing_foreign_keys.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_migrations.py'], 'message': "Ensure migration 209 works with NULL fkey values

Modify the sub-query on migration 209's backup to not select NULL
items which cause the NOT IN to always be false and consequently
the backup not to run resulting in a violation of the foreign keys.

To test, add an instance with NULL uuid to check the backups still
work correctly and avoid violating the foreign key constraint.
If there are NULL values in a NOT IN () set the result is always
false. Therefore having this instance inserted causes migration 209
to fail unless the IN set sub-query is modified appropriately.

Change-Id: Id0f8c8cb082df8861e85f925b979ddd934a95bfc
Closes-Bug: 1240325
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ensure migration 209 works with NULL fkey values

Modify the sub-query on migration 209's backup to not select NULL
items which cause the NOT IN to always be false and consequently
the backup not to run resulting in a violation of the foreign keys.

To test, add an instance with NULL uuid to check the backups still
work correctly and avoid violating the foreign key constraint.
If there are NULL values in a NOT IN () set the result is always
false. Therefore having this instance inserted causes migration 209
to fail unless the IN set sub-query is modified appropriately.

Change-Id: Id0f8c8cb082df8861e85f925b979ddd934a95bfc
Closes-Bug: 1240325

commit_message:

names it takes as join targets. This will let us pre-load things
on the instances that get fetched out.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

commit_message:
Fixing ephemeral disk creation.

The patch addresses 2 scenarios, which occur when
CONF.default_ephemeral_format was provided:

1. Creation of ephemeral block devices would fail,
   due to permission issues, during an attempt to format it without sudo,
   in _create_local.
2. The device/image would be formatted twice, while the final
   filesystem will differ from the one provided in
   CONF.default_ephemeral_format.

This patch will format only once, relying on the changed
disk.mkfs command, that takes CONF.default_ephemeral_format
into consideration.
It will also run the command as root only for block devices,
according to the disk_image is_block_dev property.

Closes-Bug: #1204424
Change-Id: I2bf7abc982e20eaaf7bca7cd798b4134b76d10a8

subject: Fix getting nwinfo for Instance obj
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 17:18:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_utils.py', 'nova/compute/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix getting nwinfo for Instance obj

This fixes the get_nw_info_for_instance() method in nova/compute/utils.

If an instance object has no 'info_cache' (means we lack an entry in the
instance_info_caches table for the instance), don't try to access the
'network_info' attribute.  Just return a network model with empty
networking information like the dict version of an instance would do.

Change-Id: Ib1f49f10cefeefc55a87fea69b6fbc772c978dca
Closes-bug: 1243291
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix getting nwinfo for Instance obj

This fixes the get_nw_info_for_instance() method in nova/compute/utils.

If an instance object has no 'info_cache' (means we lack an entry in the
instance_info_caches table for the instance), don't try to access the
'network_info' attribute.  Just return a network model with empty
networking information like the dict version of an instance would do.

Change-Id: Ib1f49f10cefeefc55a87fea69b6fbc772c978dca
Closes-bug: 1243291

commit_message:
Disable nova bm file injection in undercloud

We are now relying on host routes feature of neutron-dhcp-agent,
so it's time to disable nova bm file injection in undercloud
and use neutron-dhcp-agent instead (if file injection is enabled
the static route for metadata server is not set and overcloud
machines hit seed vm metadata server instead of undercloud one).

Co-Authored-By: Derek Higgins <derekh@redhat.com>

Partial-Bug: #1241042

Change-Id: I04a7fb0399031cbf475a427cceac080296f9bc8d

commit_message:
Adds identity v2 tests to show extra behavior

The v2 API uses name instead of username for the user entity.  This will
change soon to match the spec.  Theses tests will ensure the existing
behavior isn't broken.

Change-Id: Ic6830976f246f707c8b7ef8e92a1697d19fdfe67
Related-Bug: #1214686

commit_message:

change request fixes. I've also added support the the uWSGI stats server,
which is required to provide New Relic support for uWSGI monitoring.

commit_message:
Add testr concurrency option for run_tests.sh

By exposing this testr concurrency option, run_tests.sh can now specify
how many processes to run the tests. If not specified, default 0 utilize
maximum CPUs available.

Change-Id: I1a518ae67db32d9838e4a3584cfc3af14212be3c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-25 14:34:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes unicode issue in the Hyper-V driver

The XML string returned by the WMI API calls requires unicode
conversion before further processing, e.g. with ElementTree.

This affects the vhdutilsv2._get_vhd_info_xml method due to
the textual description. The issue came to light using the
host with Chinese locale, while not present on a en_US host.

Change-Id: I09435a205abfc8ae9470c53c5446cbb28dee0115
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-17 21:00:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/vhdutilsv2.py'], 'message': 'Fixes unicode issue in the Hyper-V driver

The XML string returned by the WMI API calls requires unicode
conversion before further processing, e.g. with ElementTree.

This affects the vhdutilsv2._get_vhd_info_xml method due to
the textual description. The issue came to light using the

commit_message:
Fixes unicode issue in the Hyper-V driver

The XML string returned by the WMI API calls requires unicode
conversion before further processing, e.g. with ElementTree.

This affects the vhdutilsv2._get_vhd_info_xml method due to
the textual description. The issue came to light using the
host with Chinese locale, while not present on a en_US host.

Fixes bug: #1229671

Change-Id: I09435a205abfc8ae9470c53c5446cbb28dee0115

commit_message:
python3: sort dict for post_volumes_1234_action test

In Python 3, hash randomization is enabled by default. It causes the
iteration order of dicts and sets to be unpredictable and differ across
Python runs.

Sort the list and update the expecting result.

Change-Id: Iead7ca8f45b035abd78f0b25865b5f7e1b9f3294
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

subject: python3: align the order of parameters for urlencode()
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-13 13:49:37.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v1/volume_snapshots.py', 'cinderclient/v2/volume_snapshots.py'], 'message': 'python3: align the order of parameters for urlencode()

In Python 3.3, hash randomization is enabled by default. It causes the
iteration order of dicts and sets to be unpredictable and differ across
Python runs.

In the test case, the fixed expecting string will not match the test
result, it is relying on the dict order.

This change transforms the input dict to a sequence of two-element list,
with fixed order, and update the related expecitng string in test case.

Change-Id: I60d7bb3c4f940b76460ad5c417a1807915e0418e
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
python3: align the order of parameters for urlencode()

In Python 3.3, hash randomization is enabled by default. It causes the
iteration order of dicts and sets to be unpredictable and differ across
Python runs.

In the test case, the fixed expecting string will not match the test
result, it is relying on the dict order.

This change transforms the input dict to a sequence of two-element list,
with fixed order, and update the related expecitng string in test case.

Change-Id: I60d7bb3c4f940b76460ad5c417a1807915e0418e
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

subject: Ensure the network is scheduled to an dhcp-agent
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-23 12:04:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Wait until neutron dhcp-agent becomes ready

For some reason DHCP-agent is not present in neutron
agent-list output immediately after start, so we have
to wait a bit.

Change-Id: Ib40183a21e6ca99fa46e5b94782535cad980eec2
Partial-Bug: #1241042
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-23 15:02:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Ensure the network is scheduled to an dhcp-agent

For some reason DHCP-agent is not present in neutron
agent-list output immediately after start, so we have
to wait a bit.

Neutron doesn't schedule new networks immediately, but
rather waits for the first port to be allocated on the
network. So we have a kind of a race here, because we
also create a neutron router which effectively triggers
port allocation and scheduling of the network. We should
be able to proceed in both cases: when the router was
created before we scheduled the network manually and vice
versa.

Partial-Bug: #1241042
Related-Bug: #1231366

Change-Id: Ib40183a21e6ca99fa46e5b94782535cad980eec2
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-23 19:41:52.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh'], 'message': 'Ensure the network is scheduled to an dhcp-agent

For some reason DHCP-agent is not present in neutron
agent-list output immediately after start, so we have
to wait a bit.

By the time we are going to schedule the neutron network
to the dhcp agent it might have already been scheduled,
so we should be able to handle this case too.

Partial-Bug: #1241042
Related-Bug: #1231366

Change-Id: Ib40183a21e6ca99fa46e5b94782535cad980eec2
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Ensure the network is scheduled to an dhcp-agent

For some reason DHCP-agent is not present in neutron
agent-list output immediately after start, so we have
to wait a bit.

By the time we are going to schedule the neutron network
to the dhcp agent it might have already been scheduled,
so we should be able to handle this case too.

Partial-Bug: #1241042
Related-Bug: #1231366

Change-Id: Ib40183a21e6ca99fa46e5b94782535cad980eec2

commit_message:
Use neutron-dhcp-agent dhcp driver by default

We are now relying on neutron-dhcp-agent features
like host routes, so we must use neutron-dhcp-agent
in undercloud instead of bm-dnsmasq in order to
deploy overcloud properly.

Co-Authored-By: Derek Higgins <derekh@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1241042

Change-Id: I71b5efa72eaddb3ec07eda25336f421393635c1a

Change _send_gratuitous_arp_packet() to spawn a thread to call
arping after a floating IP is assigned.  This way it doesn't
stall _process_routers() from returning quickly due to calling
pool.waitall().

commit_message:
Spawn arping in thread to speed-up floating IP

Change _send_gratuitous_arp_packet() to spawn a thread to call
arping after a floating IP is assigned.  This way it doesn't
stall _process_routers() from returning quickly due to calling
pool.waitall().

Fixes Bug: 1233391

Change-Id: Id1f5eb75c222ba6a0935a294e3973292f50d0559

commit_message:
Move network_vlan_range conf to right place

The neutron configuration has network_vlan_types in the wrong place.
They should be in the tables with their plugins instead of in the common
table 4.1.

NOTE: If someone runs the generator again this change will need to be made
again until the generator is fixed!

Fixes-bug: #1243780
Backport: havana
Change-Id: Ie99afbe1f1ac6071fb1379f0457711976f568461

commit_message:
Move network_vlan_range conf to right place

The neutron configuration has network_vlan_types in the wrong place.
They should be in the tables with their plugins instead of in the common
table 4.1.

NOTE: If someone runs the generator again this change will need to be made
again until the generator is fixed!

Fixes-bug: #1243780
Backport: havana
Change-Id: Ie99afbe1f1ac6071fb1379f0457711976f568461

subject: Handle NotFound exceptions in API
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-23 19:54:39.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/v1/volumes.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/volume_actions.py'], 'message': "Handle NotFound exceptions in API

There were a number of calls in the API that
weren't catching NotFound exceptions.  The result is
unhandled exception traces and errors in the logs on good
runs in tempest.

Basicly any negative test that requests a non-existent element
would result in an unhandled exception.  This patch adds try/except
around the volume_api.getxxx calls in cinder/api/... methods to
clean this up.

Change-Id: I703314393eeaaf60f9944684dbe9015e416deeac
Closes-Bug: #1243724
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Handle NotFound exceptions in API

There were a number of calls in the API that
weren't catching NotFound exceptions.  The result is
unhandled exception traces and errors in the logs on good
runs in tempest.

Basicly any negative test that requests a non-existent element
would result in an unhandled exception.  This patch adds try/except
around the volume_api.getxxx calls in cinder/api/... methods to
clean this up.

Change-Id: I703314393eeaaf60f9944684dbe9015e416deeac
Closes-Bug: #1243724

commit_message:
Use conductor to update backup status

Backups at present also rely on a guest's direct access
to the host DB. Adding the update_backup method to conductor
should eliminate that need.

Change-Id: Ied1e79e7fe9875a5432bf9d5a1c8566c25dd0ec1

commit_message:
Add an __str__ method to brokers

A few uses of broker.db_file are in printouts where we do need
them, so the administrator may know what's up. Seems like an easy
way to get rid of those is to make brokers identify themselves
with common __str__. Alternative back-end implementations may
supply something other than a filename here, for example a cluster
name and a volume name.

Note that I'm not sure if correct coercion would occur when
brokers are bounced through dictionaries, hence explicit str().

Change-Id: I329788ebd1fbe39ffadcf9f9d5194a74a88dde58

commit_message:
Replace assertEquals with assertEqual

The method assertEquals has been deprecated since python 2.7.
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Also in Python 3, a deprecated warning is raised when using assertEquals.

Change-Id: Iba0ae72e72470cdf5b122defcd68effc5434f948

commit_message:
utf8 encode tempurl key

In tempurl middleware, hmac uses the value of account metadata to
generate HMAC-SHA1 signature and hmac must accept a str-type string, not
a unicode string. The meta dict returned from get_info stroges special
chars as unicode however. So just encode it for tempurl using.

Closes-Bug: #1242644
Change-Id: I4be62eea014a573efc4748470de57dccf00e431d

subject: align the order of parameters for urlencode()
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-21 12:35:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'align the order of parameters for urlencode()

In Python 3.3, hash randomization is enabled by default. It causes the
iteration order of dicts and sets to be unpredictable and differ across
Python runs.

In the test case, the fixed expecting string will not match the test
result, it is relying on the dict order.

This change transforms the input dict to a sequence of two-element list,
with fixed order, and exchange the order of "limit" and "marker" for
expecting string.

Partial implement: blueprint py33-support

Change-Id: If9c25fb0d457b31034111e7e879f1f95a576a78f
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-23 11:20:15.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/v1/stacks.py', 'heatclient/tests/test_stacks.py'], 'message': 'align the order of parameters for urlencode()

In Python 3.3, hash randomization is enabled by default. It causes the
iteration order of dicts and sets to be unpredictable and differ across
Python runs.

In the test case, the fixed expecting string will not match the test
result, it is relying on the dict order.

This change transforms the input dict to a sequence of two-element list,
with fixed order, and exchange the order of "limit" and "marker" for
expecting string.

Partial implement: blueprint py33-support

Change-Id: If9c25fb0d457b31034111e7e879f1f95a576a78f
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
align the order of parameters for urlencode()

In Python 3.3, hash randomization is enabled by default. It causes the
iteration order of dicts and sets to be unpredictable and differ across
Python runs.

In the test case, the fixed expecting string will not match the test
result, it is relying on the dict order.

This change transforms the input dict to a sequence of two-element list,
with fixed order, and exchange the order of "limit" and "marker" for
expecting string.

Partial implement: blueprint py33-support

Change-Id: If9c25fb0d457b31034111e7e879f1f95a576a78f

subject: Simplify test for hashed tokens, to cope with large v3 tokens
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 13:35:35.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/cms.py'], 'message': "Simplify test for hashed tokens, to cope with large v3 tokens

The current approach of checking the identfier octets at the start
of the token string seems error prone, and doesn't work with large
tokens, as noted in the comments.

Instead, use knowledge of the content and size of the hex-encoded
hashed token, which will be a 32 character hex string (in the case
of both UUID and PKI tokens) - i.e if it doesn't meet the expected
criteria it should be hashed.

Change-Id: I3e7907c474dd350b08abdf488bc36a0c82541de6
Partial-Bug: #1240163
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Simplify test for hashed tokens, to cope with large v3 tokens

The current approach of checking the identfier octets at the start
of the token string seems error prone, and doesn't work with large
tokens, as noted in the comments.

Instead, use knowledge of the content and size of the hex-encoded
hashed token, which will be a 32 character hex string (in the case
of both UUID and PKI tokens) - i.e if it doesn't meet the expected
criteria it should be hashed.

Change-Id: I3e7907c474dd350b08abdf488bc36a0c82541de6
Partial-Bug: #1240163

commit_message:
Add byte unit constants

A lots of numeric expressions are needed to caculate byte number
across Nova project, such as 1024*1024 , 1024**3 etc. This patch
add constants and will replace these numeric expressions in
following patches. That makes code more readable.Use these constants
like: root_disk_gb = 5 * unit.Gi

blueprint byte-unit-clean

Change-Id: Ic9aad949733d375aaa695d4292ff1b171d1def78

commit_message:
Use random network in boot_server scenario

In this scneario we are going to run a lot of VMs one by one.
Usually one network has about 500 fixed ips (or we will get performance issues)

So if we are going to run 2k vms we should use at least 4 networks.

To simplify configuration of this test. We will by default chose
random network to get ip for vm.

Change-Id: If5d8c52b4f02315be2bcc542baf43cdcc0989316

commit_message:
Deprecates --volume-id arg for v2 backup-restore

This patch deprecates the --volume-id arg of backup-restore
when using the v2 api and adds (preferred) --volume arg.
Both args are still usable but the former is now listed as
"Deprecated" in the help message.

Change-Id: I2575d93041b26f971c59bc04828b356556617b62
Fixes: bug 1242816

commit_message:
Fix precondition checks for test_network_basic_ops

Running tempest with quantum disabled would previously raise
skip exceptions indicating that one of public_router_id or
public_network_id was required.  These values are not required
if quantum is disabled.  This change ensures that the presence
of these values will only be checked if quantum is enabled.

The master branch already behaves this way, but the behavior
there relies on a refactor that would have been difficult to
backport.

Change-Id: I4eee9403b219fd97d16faae0ed2b11348edbc04e
Closes-Bug: #1243593

commit_message:
Include troveclient/compat/tests in testr

All tests should be included in testr.

In test_common.py, the testr command line will be read for parsing,
finally emit error message:
run.py: error: no such option: -t

we should mock the sys.argv in setUp().

The analysis is here
--------------------
troveclient/compat/common.py: CommandsBase
254     def _parse_options(self, parser):
255         opts, args = parser.parse_args()  <-- 1. no arg is passed

/usr/lib/python2.7/optparse.py
1361     def _get_args(self, args):
1362         if args is None:
1363             return sys.argv[1:]  <-- 3. cmdline(testr command) is read
1364         else:
1365             return args[:]

1367     def parse_args(self, args=None, values=None):
...
1381         rargs = self._get_args(args) <-- 2. args is None

Close-Bug #1241845

Change-Id: I092db96d1b6bb31c41e6ba4c5fc9606e3f8ac087

commit_message:
Replace g.next() with next(g)

In Python 3, g.next() has been renamed to g.__next__().
The next() buildin function will work fine for Python 2&3.

Partial implements: blueprint py33-support
Change-Id: I992d019eb180f514388f21b2400b51c94c7bdad5

commit_message:
fixed the error when restarting quantum-server

When setup a network node which is not include
the quantum-server daemon by default, there will
be an error in the recipes ./openstack-network/recipes/
openvswitch.rb when retarting quantum-server service.
This error doesn't affect the whole procedure. My fixes
will check whether the quantum-server in the role-list.
It will not output the error again.

Change-Id: Iad276aaafb457add9f7829fbaf40680d70814ee4
Closes-Bug: #1231850

Fix unicode issue

In Python 3, all string is unicode.
Replace unicode() with six.u()
Make use of strutils.to_slug() for slugify() definition

Partial implements: blueprint py33-support

commit_message:
Added New Files for Vagrant Install Mode

Vagrant uses eth0 of the Virtual Machine for communicating with the
VM, manually changing the network port is not possible as Vagrant
overrides it. So change in the network interfaces is done as a work
around till we get a fix for this issue.

b/p training-manuals

Change-Id: I618058c0c5395c00fd21168ee973aca7ec68f19f

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 4463, 'name': 'iccha-sethi', 'email': 'iccha.sethi@rackspace.com', 'username': 'iccha-sethi'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 15:52:57.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Exclude iso8601 version 0.1.7

The iso8601 package had a 0.1.7 release on October 19th.
Unfortunately, it cannot be installed under Python 3.3 due to a
unicode character in its README.rst, which is read by its
setup.py.  This causes our py33 gates to fail.  The temporary
solution is to exclude 0.1.7.  As a more permanent solution, I
have reported this as a bug[1] to the iso8601 developer, which
should hopefully result in a fix.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/micktwomey/pyiso8601/issue/10/setuppy-broken-for-python-33

Change-Id: Icdd8223b26caf755c8d6cd4c27c99ecea5f54a75
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Exclude iso8601 version 0.1.7

The iso8601 package had a 0.1.7 release on October 19th.
Unfortunately, it cannot be installed under Python 3.3 due to a
unicode character in its README.rst, which is read by its
setup.py.  This causes our py33 gates to fail.  The temporary
solution is to exclude 0.1.7.  As a more permanent solution, I
have reported this as a bug[1] to the iso8601 developer, which
should hopefully result in a fix.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/micktwomey/pyiso8601/issue/10/setuppy-broken-for-python-33

Change-Id: Icdd8223b26caf755c8d6cd4c27c99ecea5f54a75

commit_message:
Install Guide: fix ssh command

* Identity file is not mykey, but ~/.ssh/id_rsa (the default).
* CirrOS demands login as user cirros, not user root.

backport: havana
Change-Id: Ie707a7a35c98bc85993668b6d7576e99380b2bc3

subject: require iso8601>=0.1.8
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 18:24:53.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "require iso8601>=0.1.8

so, after a string of broken iso8601 releases, 0.1.8 might be the
winner. However, 0.1.4 is provided by precise, which means the
previous requirements statement won't actually test it on devstack
nodes.

Bump this puppy up to >=0.1.8 to see if this is actually going to
work for us across the board.

Change-Id: I63b0fdd0d8bb25e67b8b29af12d0940ad5b84401
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
require iso8601>=0.1.8

so, after a string of broken iso8601 releases, 0.1.8 might be the
winner. However, 0.1.4 is provided by precise, which means the
previous requirements statement won't actually test it on devstack
nodes.

Bump this puppy up to >=0.1.8 to see if this is actually going to
work for us across the board.

Change-Id: I63b0fdd0d8bb25e67b8b29af12d0940ad5b84401

subject: Revert "Unpin iso8601 but skip bad versions"
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 18:00:18.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Revert "Unpin iso8601 but skip bad versions"

This reverts commit 27cd9c8d08a2f9eec77ef68aa3fad5acdf0e1b7d.

0.1.7 was never actually tested with python 3.3 before this change
was made. Revert back to the pin at 0.1.4 until we *know* we have
a good working version.

Change-Id: I8949e1fce26aab783c117ce389db3a4066d5348f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Unpin iso8601 but skip bad versions"

This reverts commit 27cd9c8d08a2f9eec77ef68aa3fad5acdf0e1b7d.

0.1.7 was never actually tested with python 3.3 before this change
was made. Revert back to the pin at 0.1.4 until we *know* we have
a good working version.

Change-Id: I8949e1fce26aab783c117ce389db3a4066d5348f

subject: Apply six for metaclass
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 01:01:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Apply six for metaclass

__metaclass__ cannot be used in python3.
six be used in general for python 3 compatibility.

Change-Id: Ibd31a9f91bac6ec220d802f16c77ee0306e211b3
Closes-Bug: #1236648
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-18 05:22:32.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/base.py'], 'message': 'Apply six for metaclass

The way to using metaclass has changed in Python3.

Python 2.7 way:

class Foo(object):
  __metaclass__ = FooMeta

Python 3 way:

class Foo(object, metaclass=FooMeta):
  ...

The six.add_metaclass() decorator allows us to use one syntax that
works for both Python 2.7 and Python 3.

Change-Id: Ibd31a9f91bac6ec220d802f16c77ee0306e211b3
Closes-Bug: #1236648
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Apply six for metaclass

The way to using metaclass has changed in Python3.

Python 2.7 way:

class Foo(object):
  __metaclass__ = FooMeta

Python 3 way:

class Foo(object, metaclass=FooMeta):
  ...

The six.add_metaclass() decorator allows us to use one syntax that
works for both Python 2.7 and Python 3.

Change-Id: Ibd31a9f91bac6ec220d802f16c77ee0306e211b3
Closes-Bug: #1236648

commit_message:
fix DeletableSubnet in api/network/common

DeletableSubnet._router_ids was defined as a static attribute, causing
errors on tearDown working with multiple {router,subnet} couples as it
tries to disconnect subnet from all routers existing instead of all
routers connected to it

Change-Id: Id446d7bb2be117ea56b52e6a644b259089cdc158

subject: add bash8 tool (like pep8, but way hackier)
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-14 18:10:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "add bash8 tool (like pep8, but way hackier)

unlike our python code, we have no automatic style checking for
bash. For the most part, it's not a big deal, but errant whitespace
or incorrect indenting is sometimes annoying to have to -1 people's
patches for. Instead of constantly picking it up in manual review
maybe we can do better.

This is an uber hacky script which could be used to do just that.

   ./tools/bash8.py file1 file2 file3 ...

And it will show issues found with the files at hand. Lightly
tested in the existing devstack tree, it exposes a few issues that
we might want to think about.

Change-Id: I5009fa5852595c2953a548e430e5e1ce06ae94e0
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-14 20:19:28.000000000', 'files': ['tools/bash8.py'], 'message': "add bash8 tool (like pep8, but way hackier)

unlike our python code, we have no automatic style checking for
bash. For the most part, it's not a big deal, but errant whitespace
or incorrect indenting is sometimes annoying to have to -1 people's
patches for. Instead of constantly picking it up in manual review
maybe we can do better.

This is an uber hacky script which could be used to do just that.

   ./tools/bash8.py file1 file2 file3 ...

And it will show issues found with the files at hand. Lightly
tested in the existing devstack tree, it exposes a few issues that
we might want to think about.

This should be python 3 compatible, and includes argparse to provide
a basic '-h' support to explain how the command should be run.

Change-Id: I5009fa5852595c2953a548e430e5e1ce06ae94e0
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
add bash8 tool (like pep8, but way hackier)

unlike our python code, we have no automatic style checking for
bash. For the most part, it's not a big deal, but errant whitespace
or incorrect indenting is sometimes annoying to have to -1 people's
patches for. Instead of constantly picking it up in manual review
maybe we can do better.

This is an uber hacky script which could be used to do just that.

   ./tools/bash8.py file1 file2 file3 ...

And it will show issues found with the files at hand. Lightly
tested in the existing devstack tree, it exposes a few issues that
we might want to think about.

This should be python 3 compatible, and includes argparse to provide
a basic '-h' support to explain how the command should be run.

Change-Id: I5009fa5852595c2953a548e430e5e1ce06ae94e0

commit_message:
port test_flavors into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. This is being tried in order to make
reviewing of the porting easier as gerrit will display only what
is actually changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

Change-Id: I4146e119adadbcf07392ce17294b5df191a71fb6

commit_message:
Fix lb doesn't remove vxlan int. if no int. map

if interface_mappings is not set.

Fixes bug: 1240742

commit_message:
Add env var for choosing of deploy image element

Make sure we can easily switch between deploy and
deploy-kexec image elements when building a deploy
ramdisk by setting the environment variable.

Default to deploy, because deploy-kexec is not reliable
right now and our production-like cloud (TripleOCloud)
has switched to deploy.

Change-Id: Ia9dc58a5de6a7677824eebc82d13888355378b77

commit_message:
Remove deprecated libvirt VIF driver code

Libvirt vif specific driver classes have been replaced by a generic
driver LibvirtGenericVIFDriver and are deprecated in Havana, so we
can remove them safely.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icecb3c9aa4282c511364107d87f8aba517a5ae14
Closes-Bug: 1235036

commit_message:
Replace tests.base part1

It is the first step to replace using ceilometer.tests.base with
openstack.common.test.
Displacement method assertTimestampEqual() from TestCase to
BaseTestCase class in base.py because TestCase
will not be used in the future.

Change-Id: Ic56041516a142590e0ee869e60f939c5245ca977

commit_message:
Fixes Invalid tag name error when using k:v tagname

This patch fixes the invalid tag name error when k:v type
tagname appears in response of api during xml serialization,
the tagname which contains colon couldn't be supported by
default since it is reserved by xml namespace, this patch
solve it by adding the k of k:v tagname into namespace.

Fixes bug: #1213927

Change-Id: Ib20efb378425cbe5deef45fbac561955cbe0f7bc

subject: xenapi: ephemeral disk partition should fill disk
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-18 17:32:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py', 'nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py'], 'message': 'xenapi: ephemeral disk partition should fill disk

The current code looks to specify the expected start and finish values
for the partition. A unit miss match between what nova and parted count
as a GB seem to cause the difference.

As we just want to fill the whole disk, we can pass "-0" as the end
value, to tell parted to extend the partition to the end of the disk.

Fixes bug 1241734
Change-Id: Ie4753d9de1e20561b8f96360e879075498a5ef58
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
xenapi: ephemeral disk partition should fill disk

The current code looks to specify the expected start and finish values
for the partition. A unit miss match between what nova and parted count
as a GB seem to cause the difference.

As we just want to fill the whole disk, we can pass "-0" as the end
value, to tell parted to extend the partition to the end of the disk.

Fixes bug 1241734
Change-Id: Ie4753d9de1e20561b8f96360e879075498a5ef58

      nova.disk.api.mkfs will use nova.utils.mkfs,
      unless an aribitary mkfs command has been provided by the user.
      Preserving the default filesystem to be used for each os_type.

      Also, adding the run_as_root parameter to utils.mkfs, to allow it
      handle block devices.

commit_message:
Merging two mkfs commands.

nova.disk.api.mkfs will use nova.utils.mkfs,
unless an arbitrary mkfs command has been provided by the user.
Preserving the default filesystem to be used for each os_type.

Also, adding run_as_root parameter to utils.mkfs, to allow it
handle block devices.

Change-Id: I3ca21e0ee80caa7e1152ebae56d73ed3c14844c0

subject: Add V2 rpc api for consoleauth
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-14 23:29:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add V2 rpc api for consoleauth

Add support for the 2.0 consoleauth rpc API.  This commit retains
compatibility with the older 1.X API to allow continuous deployment
without any downtime.

UpgradeImpact - Deployments doing continuous deployment should follow
this process to upgrade without any downtime with the consoleauth
service:

    1) Sync all consoleauth services to this commit, so that they handle
       both new and old messages.

    2) Upgrade everything else to this commit so that all clients start
       sending the new messages.

    3) Upgrade past this, where support for the old messages will be
       dropped.

Part of blueprint rpc-major-version-updates-icehouse

commit_message:
Add V2 rpc api for consoleauth

Add support for the 2.0 consoleauth rpc API.  This commit retains
compatibility with the older 1.X API to allow continuous deployment
without any downtime.

UpgradeImpact - Deployments doing continuous deployment should follow
this process to upgrade without any downtime with the consoleauth
service:

    1) Sync all consoleauth services to this commit, so that they handle
       both new and old messages.

    2) Upgrade everything else to this commit so that all clients start
       sending the new messages.

    3) Upgrade past this, where support for the old messages will be
       dropped.

Part of blueprint rpc-major-version-updates-icehouse

Change-Id: Iad71d3c2801f9355968e69bce3308b84f922b239

commit_message:
Revert "remove cinder-rtstool because of rtslib dep"

This reverts commit b66c3361be2095186e19b0d44e49a8b2c48f7235.

Dependencies of this code (rtslib-fb) are now Apache-licensed,
which resolves the previous issue with this code being in-tree.

This patch is a direct revert, other patches will follow to
line up changes that have occurred between b66c336 and now.

Conflicts:
	setup.py

Blueprint: lio-rtslib

Change-Id: I14786bddf419d98ff7c468b185462f5387dbbba1

commit_message:
Nexenta drivers ignore "does not exist" exception

Ignore "does not exist" exception in NFS and iSCSI driver,
delete_volume and delete_snapshot methods.
This exceptions means that the volume or the snapshot not exists in the
backend, so we can avoid "delete" errors, when the resource was already
deleted.

Closes-Bug: 1240650
Change-Id: I3b2684097dcb95ba50a67c94a353dc3f17374777

commit_message:
Allow users to change their own email address

Adds a new dashboard to change own email address.

Users without admin rights can't get their current email address
thus the corresponding form field is empty, but a successful
change displays the new email address in the modal popup.

Closes-Bug: #884492
Change-Id: I5aa63caf6a1f4d4b1a89d18519600b091591f3ab

commit_message:
Returns an extra UUID field in baremetal node responses.

In order to use force_node functionality.  Clients must specify:
--availability_zone=zone:<host>:node_uuid

Right now the Baremetal Node UUID is not returned via any API call
and thus there is no way for the client to discover it. This patch
returns an extra UUID field in Nova Baremetal Node API responses.

Partial-Bug #1184449

Change-Id: I46abc121cd3bb5466aa78e576ce8e7a620943807

[{'created': '2013-07-04 20:21:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow user to specify instance resume behaviour on host reboot

The configuration option resume_guests_state_on_host_boot defines
a global policy on whether or not to restart instances when a host
reboots.  Because a host may be down for a significant period of
time many cloud applications monitor their own instances and launch

The blueprint provides the user with a mechanism to specify the

Supported values are:

the ServiceGroup API for that.

commit_message:
Allow user to specify instance resume behaviour on host reboot

The configuration option resume_guests_state_on_host_boot defines
a global policy on whether or not to restart instances when a host
reboots.  Because a host may be down for a significant period of
time many cloud applications monitor their own instances and launch
replacements restarting all instances is rarely the required behaviour

The blueprint provides the user with a mechanism to specify the
resume policy on a per instance basis.

Supported values are:
  Default -  use system configuration value (current behaviour)
  Never   -  Don't resume this instance
  Always  -  Always resume this instance

This is the first part of the blueprint which implements the resume
decision.   The API extension will be provided in a separate commit

Code is structured to allow a futher option of "Resume only if host
has been down for less than xxx seconds" - but we need support from
the ServiceGroup API for that.

Partly implements bp: user-defined-resume

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1f2969a9a32f8bf7c6b52ef76a7e2ac54e17554d

commit_message:
Add an environment variable to enable extensions in keystone

Bug #1218733

Add an array variable to process keystone extenstions:
KEYSTONE_ADDITIONAL_EXTENSIONS=(oauth1:oauth_extension
   endpoint_filter:endpoint_filter_extension)

Change-Id: I77486e64d14b76c4051294aff45f47a8feccd328

commit_message:
Remove from_migration_import() and use autoload=True instead

Many of the older database migrations used an awkward method of loading
the schema of a table from a previous migration. This has caused at least
one bug where a column was missing by accident.

Manually writing out the schema turns out to be unnecessary since
SQLAlchemy has a way to load the existing schema from the database with
the autoload=True parameter. In fact all of the migrations beyond 010
do this already.

Change-Id: I303710479ebb617495cd834777963d8dfcc01f54

Currently, nova-network would create vlan device automatically if

just makes sure the newly created vlan device is up, but not bridge
interface. Thus, the vlan device is left on M-DOWN state on this

commit_message:
nova-network: make sure bridge device is up on creating vlan

Currently, nova-network would create vlan device automatically if
it doesn't exist on host. However, on creating vlan device, nova
just makes sure the newly created vlan device is up, but not bridge
interface. Thus, the vlan device is left on M-DOWN state on this
situation, and instance network is not accessable.

This patch fixes this problem by setting bridge interface up before
creating vlan device, vlan device is always up after being created.

Bug 1232699

Change-Id: If3b2f26e84505b27aa5d0ce264d7e05118cbf584

commit_message:
NetApp fix mirrored stats

This fixes the incorrect reporting of mirrorred
statistics for NetApp iscsi and nfs backend.
The uninitialized and broken snapmirror is
not reported and only snapmirrored state
is reported back.

Closes-Bug:#1242808

Change-Id: I4b9f788e1f99b78d12db23bd92b6a277d5f64cb3

commit_message:
Expose additional status in baremetal API extension

Add fields: uuid, task_state, updated_at, and pxe_config_path
to aid system admins in troubleshooting issues.

Fixes bug 1184449

commit_message:
Validate parameters of agent API

The agent API has some parameters, but they are not validated.
Each parameter is stored to the table "agent_builds", and each column
is defined as varchar(255).

mysql> desc agent_builds;
+--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+
| Field        | Type         | Null | Key | Default | Extra          |
+--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+
| created_at   | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| updated_at   | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| deleted_at   | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| id           | int(11)      | NO   | PRI | NULL    | auto_increment |
| hypervisor   | varchar(255) | YES  | MUL | NULL    |                |
| os           | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| architecture | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| version      | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| url          | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| md5hash      | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| deleted      | int(11)      | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
+--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+

This patch adds the validation with the type and the length.

Closes-Bug: 1240458

Change-Id: Id06235ebde62f7b96c55b0bd2be5d941bfd2e999

Closes-Bug: #1241923

When OFFLINE=True, we should check if the system has the right pip.
If the pip is of the right version, the install pip sh exit.
If the pip is not of the right version and OFFLINE is True, the sh
complains and exits.
If the system has no pip installed at all and OFFLINE is True, the sh
complains and exits.

Change-Id: I094e6ded29d0053e9b97cb82791c4bee56d095b9

commit_message:
Let OFFLINE=True work when installing pip

Closes-Bug: #1241923

When OFFLINE=True, we should check if the system has the right pip.
If the pip is of the right version, the install pip sh exit.
If the pip is not of the right version and OFFLINE is True, the sh
complains and exits.
If the system has no pip installed at all and OFFLINE is True, the sh
complains and exits.

Change-Id: I094e6ded29d0053e9b97cb82791c4bee56d095b9
