commit_message:
Uses oslo.imageutils

Commit 035668 had the QemuImgInfo class moved to Oslo.
This class was copied from Nova to Cinder and diverged since then.
The two projects will be able to use identical classes by importing imageutils.

Change-Id: If1962680906b3736d3f16f306b077483b122f878

commit_message:
Fix status code of server's action confirm_resize for v3

The status code of confirm_resize should be 202, but it
returns 204 now. That because it returns HTTPNoContent
that overwrites the status code of decorator 'wsgi.response(202)'

And adds API samples for confirm_resize that used to test
the status code of confirm_resize.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests
Closes-bug: #1233561

Change-Id: I50a3046866af0a1efdb5c41ded40f973b02843e8

commit_message:
Decreasing integration test for cluster configs

Earlier integration test for cluster configs and Swift did the same step: check Swift availability.
Now test for Swift was deleted from test for cluster configs.
Swift availability is checked only in test for Swift.

Change-Id: I19be0d126d015a2eef598aa8a0a71de110c0ebaa

subject: Support for optional task arguments
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 07:40:27.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/task.py', 'taskflow/utils/reflection.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_task.py'], 'message': "Support for optional task arguments

We used to ignore optional task arguments (arguments of 'execute' method
with default value). With this change flow author can pass such
arguments to task by mentioning them in 'requires' and/or 'rebind'
task constructor parameters.

Change-Id: Ib92f87eb05623d30db6f1691d75c11376d45c87a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Support for optional task arguments

We used to ignore optional task arguments (arguments of 'execute' method
with default value). With this change flow author can pass such
arguments to task by mentioning them in 'requires' and/or 'rebind'
task constructor parameters.

Change-Id: Ib92f87eb05623d30db6f1691d75c11376d45c87a

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
exit cleanup in functions

we should always use die instead of exit so that we know why we
failed.

Also remove instances where exit is called after die, as that is
a noop.

Change-Id: I8e08cce63d35c503c36ff1e09805f3db427d082d

commit_message:
Use isolation credentials for neutron api tests

This commit just adds the use of isolated credentials to the neutron
api tests if tenant isolation is enabled. Previously the neutron
tests would all run in the same tenant regardless of the config
option.

Change-Id: Ide9c4a3ed543b917bd401561c601f9897bd7db50

Per http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt, when a 401 error is returned, the
Www-Authenticate response header MUST also be returned. The format is
described in http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2617.txt.

Swift supports and/or implements a number of authentication schemes
including tempauth, Keystone, tempurl, formpost and container sync. In
this fix, we use a catch-all, "Swift". The realm is the account (where
known) or "unknown" (bad path or where the 401 is returned from code
that does not have the request). Examples:

     Www-Authenticate: Swift realm="AUTH_1234567889"
     Www-Authenticate: Swift realm="unknown"

Fixes bug #1215491

commit_message:
Add WWW-Authenticate to 401 responses

Per http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt, when a 401 error is returned, the
Www-Authenticate response header MUST also be returned. The format is
described in http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2617.txt.

Swift supports and/or implements a number of authentication schemes
including tempauth, Keystone, tempurl, formpost and container sync. In
this fix, we use a catch-all, "Swift". The realm is the account (where
known) or "unknown" (bad path or where the 401 is returned from code
that does not have the request). Examples:

     Www-Authenticate: Swift realm="AUTH_1234567889"
     Www-Authenticate: Swift realm="unknown"

Fixes bug #1215491

Change-Id: I03362789318dfa156d3733ef9348795062a9cfc4

commit_message:
Let GPFS driver to rename snapshot with root permission

Deleting GPFS volume snapshot operation fails, because cinder
volume is not running with root permission.

Change-Id: Id00357030da171fddbc6abf82603ceabe4db73ff
Closes-Bug: #1242549

commit_message:
Drop auth_token configs for api-paste.ini.

We now prefer to use cinder.conf to configure keystoneclients
auth_token configs.

Also, Devstack has now been update to allow this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52259/

Related-Bug #1240753

Change-Id: I2a4b300af37eddf5010b97ca796f0552941642a8

commit_message:
Make cells info_cache updates more tolerant

Allow lists or network models to be passed in for
instance['info_cache']['network_info'] in cells updates.  Ultimately
these messages will become more consistent when fully converted to objects.

Change-Id: Ifd46a3060418b3e2e4073c3b232937a18a225f99
Closes-bug: 1240730

Fix volume transfer href issue

The volume transfer collection in url defined as "os-volume-tranfer",
but I got another define "tranfers" in href url. They are different.
So it should be modify.

commit_message:
server status remained in unexpected state

Two test case in the test_servers_negative change the 'one' servers
into a stable not active state. We are waiting 2 times 400 sec for
getting active state in vain.
Having those test cases to restore the expected state.

The deleted server related rebuild and reboot test case create are
merged and it creates and deletes one server.

Closes-Bug: #1241588

Change-Id: Ie1b9dc62bad2bf7b8595da2c9d6f994c646a0025
(cherry picked from commit 6fab1a1540ec9c38413b1a028bb367b849fa4038)

subject: Fix printing of keys with non-string values
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 15:33:49.000000000', 'files': ['os_apply_config/tests/test_apply_config.py', 'os_apply_config/apply_config.py'], 'message': "Fix printing of keys with non-string values

When trying to print a key which has a non-string value
(e.g. bool or int), TypeError exception is raised. This
is caused by the fact, that ensure_type() function accepts
string values, but parsed values are passed (i.e. False
instead of 'False' or 12 instead of '12' and so on).

Change-Id: I10f5e60994bc34288f15af07d2d255ace3755b57
Closes-Bug: #1243263
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix printing of keys with non-string values

When trying to print a key which has a non-string value
(e.g. bool or int), TypeError exception is raised. This
is caused by the fact, that ensure_type() function accepts
string values, but parsed values are passed (i.e. False
instead of 'False' or 12 instead of '12' and so on).

Change-Id: I10f5e60994bc34288f15af07d2d255ace3755b57
Closes-Bug: #1243263

commit_message:
Install Guide: Don't use obsolete sql_connection

For neutron and ceilometer, sql_connection is deprecated use
instead:
[database]
connection

Fixes some wrong format connection strings.

Also, reconnect_interval is deprecated in favor of retry_interval

Change-Id: Ieb72349bafcbd1795d64f832d64fdbce695147bf
Backport: stable/havana
Partial-Bug: #1243131
Closes-Bug: #1205060

Before this change we used to loose any progress details set by task

Before this change we used to loose any progress details set by task
when it was updating its progress when task state was changed from
RUNNING to SUCCESS (and thus progress forced to 1.0). This commit

Change-Id: Ic90e61ee3dcf62731696a0f10134bc448e7d6384
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-18 08:37:02.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_storage.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/task_action.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_progress.py'], 'message': 'Do not erase task progress details

when it was updating its progress when task state was changed from
RUNNING to SUCCESS (and thus progress forced to 1.0). This commit
fixes this, so that when progress is updated from the engine latest

commit_message:
Do not erase task progress details

Before this change we used to loose any progress details set by task
when it was updating its progress when task state was changed from
RUNNING to SUCCESS (and thus progress forced to 1.0). This commit
fixes this, so that when progress is updated from the engine latest
progress details are preserved.

Breaking change: to allow details to be associated with progress
value they were set for we save progress and then return progress
value with details.

Change-Id: Ic90e61ee3dcf62731696a0f10134bc448e7d6384

subject: Remove AWS style syntax from HOT templates
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-22 08:15:45.000000000', 'files': ['hot/F18/NovaInstanceWithCinderVolume_Native.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove AWS style syntax from HOT templates

This patch removed AWS style syntax from samples in the heat-templates
repository to not advocate their use in future HOT templates.

The current HOT template parser in the engine uses a camel case to snake case
conversion but this is going to be removed in favor of strict HOT keyword
checking. Therefore, we do not want to advocate syntax in HOT templates that
will break in the future.

Change-Id: I2aab31b64c863d2a62d3c7e57c0fb983419c3186
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove AWS style syntax from HOT templates

This patch removed AWS style syntax from samples in the heat-templates
repository to not advocate their use in future HOT templates.

The current HOT template parser in the engine uses a camel case to snake case
conversion but this is going to be removed in favor of strict HOT keyword
checking. Therefore, we do not want to advocate syntax in HOT templates that
will break in the future.

Change-Id: I2aab31b64c863d2a62d3c7e57c0fb983419c3186

subject: Faster swift-dispersion-populate
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-05 23:28:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/manpages/swift-dispersion-populate.1', 'bin/swift-dispersion-populate', 'etc/dispersion.conf-sample'], 'message': "Faster swift-dispersion-populate

- Makes swift-dispersion-populate a bit faster when using a larger
  dispersion_coverage with a larger part_power.
- Adds option to only run population for container OR objects
- Adds option to let you resume population at given point (useful if you
  need to resume population after a previous run error'd out or the
  like) by specifying which suffix to start at.

The original populate just randomly used uuid4().hex as a suffix on the
container/object names until all the partition's required where covered.
This isn't a big deal if you're only doing 1% coverage on a ring with a
small part power but takes ages if you're doing 100% on a larger ring.

Change-Id: I52f890a774412c1d6179f12db9081aedc58b6bc2
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Faster swift-dispersion-populate

- Makes swift-dispersion-populate a bit faster when using a larger
  dispersion_coverage with a larger part_power.
- Adds option to only run population for container OR objects
- Adds option to let you resume population at given point (useful if you
  need to resume population after a previous run error'd out or the
  like) by specifying which suffix to start at.

The original populate just randomly used uuid4().hex as a suffix on the
container/object names until all the partition's required where covered.
This isn't a big deal if you're only doing 1% coverage on a ring with a
small part power but takes ages if you're doing 100% on a larger ring.

Change-Id: I52f890a774412c1d6179f12db9081aedc58b6bc2

commit_message:
Implementation of opt-out from catalog data during token validation.

The additional query parameter nocatalog in GET /v3/auth/tokens allows
the requestor to receive a token response omitting the catalog data.
This makes the token response sensibly smaller in case the catalog is
large due to the vaste deployment environment and available services.

e.g. GET /v3/auth/tokens?nocatalog

blueprint token-valid-catalog-opt-out

Change-Id: I272b1282acc0f04565d88c51b87dc7e30b141b7c

subject: Be more patient with IPMI and BMC
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 19:49:01.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/drivers/test_ipmitool.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ipmitool.py'], 'message': "Be more patient with IPMI and BMC

Before the ipmitool driver called 'power status; power on' in a loop
which made the IPMI/BMCs not behave well.  Also the total time we would
wait (5 seconds) wasn't always enough.  So make sure power on/off is
only called once and wait up to 10 seconds for the power state change to
go into effect.

This is a port of change-id I5a4d7c84ebdf9c1f7d8d0570dbc31764c31f1fc6

Change-Id: I50982b24e5443b34d5597581ea2947a0301d35c9
Closes-Bug: #1234479
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Be more patient with IPMI and BMC

Before the ipmitool driver called 'power status; power on' in a loop
which made the IPMI/BMCs not behave well.  Also the total time we would
wait (5 seconds) wasn't always enough.  So make sure power on/off is
only called once and wait up to 10 seconds for the power state change to
go into effect.

This is a port of change-id I5a4d7c84ebdf9c1f7d8d0570dbc31764c31f1fc6

Change-Id: I50982b24e5443b34d5597581ea2947a0301d35c9
Closes-Bug: #1234479

[{'created': '2013-10-21 16:03:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Raise iso8601 requirement

iso8601-0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle datestring param
which missing the time part like "2011-09-05". This behavior is
different than iso8601-0.1.4, so caused glance-{api,registry}'s v1 API
controller provide different result.

Raise iso8601 requirement to >=0.1.7 will ask glance-{api,registry}'s v1
API provided consistent result to end user.

See bug #1242501 for details.

Related-Id: I2625eb3888111829a9da4d093b34193b8795f264
Change-Id: Ie6f3026b519e62e788a253b5caa6eeb5ddc245a6
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-21 17:00:23.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Raise iso8601 requirement

iso8601-0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle datestring param
which missing the time part like "2011-09-05". This behavior is
different than iso8601-0.1.4, so caused glance-{api,registry}'s v1 API
controller provide different result.

Raise iso8601 requirement to >=0.1.7 will ask glance-{api,registry}'s v1
API provided consistent result to end user.

See bug #1242501 for details.

Related-Id: I2625eb3888111829a9da4d093b34193b8795f264
Change-Id: Ie6f3026b519e62e788a253b5caa6eeb5ddc245a6
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Raise iso8601 requirement

iso8601-0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle datestring param
which missing the time part like "2011-09-05". This behavior is
different than iso8601-0.1.4, so caused glance-{api,registry}'s v1 API
controller provide different result.

Raise iso8601 requirement to >=0.1.7 will ask glance-{api,registry}'s v1
API provided consistent result to end user.

See bug #1242501 for details.

Related-Id: I2625eb3888111829a9da4d093b34193b8795f264
Change-Id: Ie6f3026b519e62e788a253b5caa6eeb5ddc245a6
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Change six to match global requirements

Pinning six to <1.4.0 causes failurs for anyone trying to use six to
port urlparse code. It also does not match with global requirements.

point, it's always supposed that: the Quantum Server is on the
controller node; and the L2 agent, DHCP agent and L3 agent are on
the network node; the L2 agent are on the compute node. We need the

commit_message:
add each role for each network main component

In typical openstack configuration, there may be 3 types nodes:
controller node, network node, and compute node. From the network
point, it's always supposed that: the Quantum Server is on the
controller node; and the L2 agent, DHCP agent and L3 agent are on
the network node; the L2 agent are on the compute node. We need the
each role for each OpenStack network main component. This will make
the configuration more flexible. So I add them here.

Change-Id: Ida4826c6dfe770b58790d75561bea42e9584ca89
Closes-Bug: #1240509

Fixes bug #1238482

commit_message:
Guess the group name for Lazily registered options

securemessage.py for example lazily registers options into the
'secure_messages' group. Current code in generator assumes that all
registration is done on the global CONF. In this review, we relax
that a bit and looks if there is only and only one OptGroup is
in the module as well and assumes that there would be a lazy
registration of the options into that OptGroup sometime later.

Partial-bug #1241634

Change-Id: I8aaa1267e32fd1080318031945fd0f7594bd6250

commit_message:
feat(shard): queue listing

Sharding need special storage driver wrapper for queue-related
operations.  The listing queue algorithm merge the listing result
from multiple storage connections, and return them in sorted order.

Note that currently the sharding implementation only returns one
storage connection, and the algorithms does not run asynchronously
yet (since there is no way to test).

Change-Id: I1fbf9c79cd49579150e4a6cd12a1d0a542d6ea7a

commit_message:
Fix wrong using of Metadata in 15,16 migrations

In up>down>up mode migrations are failing due to using of common MetaData.
It should be declared separatly for both of migration methods.

Fixes-Bug: #1240898
Change-Id: I8f6555ce44204e79a9c47b7caa1fe05970f4e3f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-21 20:35:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix remove role assignment adds role using LDAP assignment

When using the LDAP assignment backend, attempting to remove a
role assignment when the role hadn't been used before would
actually add the role assignment and would not return a

commit_message:
Fix remove role assignment adds role using LDAP assignment

When using the LDAP assignment backend, attempting to remove a
role assignment when the role hadn't been used before would
actually add the role assignment and would not return a
404 Not Found like the SQL backend.

This change makes it so that when attempt to remove a role that
wasn't assigned then 404 Not Found is returned.

Closes-Bug: #1242855
Change-Id: I28ccd26cc4bb1a241d0363d0ab52d2c11410e8b3

commit_message:
Utilizes assertIn - tests/etc

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.
Adapting assertIn will enhance the readability
of the test scripts.

Change-Id: Ib44d57e75238691234c5290d13c54c526a6ae64b

subject: Allow starting nova-compute manually
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-21 20:10:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow starting nova-compute manually

This breaks out the code that starts nova-compute into a separate
function and adds a parameter to start_nova that lets us skip
starting it. This will be used for upgrade testing so that we can
arrange for a nova-compute running on a different version of the
code to be running alongside the rest of the stack.

commit_message:
Allow starting nova-compute manually

This breaks out the code that starts nova-compute into a separate
function. This will be used for upgrade testing so that we can
arrange for a nova-compute running on a different version of the
code to be running alongside the rest of the stack.

Change-Id: I88687cefdac7fa4a3c45789461a95fd8d061aba6

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1706, 'name': 'Tom Hancock', 'email': 'tom.hancock@hp.com', 'username': 'tom-hancock'}, {'_account_id': 1865, 'name': 'Andrea Rosa', 'email': 'andrea.rosa@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-rosa-m'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 7133, 'name': 'Ryan Moore', 'email': 'ryan.moore@hpe.com', 'username': 'moory'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 15:12:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Manage None value for the 'os_type' property

The I2bab617f6c1e8866650ca7dc5178b640738c9ae6 introduced a way to pass the
'os_type' property to glance when we are doing a snapshot in the libvirt
driver. Currently the code doesn't manage properly the None value for this
property and so None value is passed to glance which creates an image with
a property called 'os_type' with value 'None'.
As results of that all instances booted from a snapshot with this property will
have None value in the os_type field.
That field is used to create file name for backing images for ephemral disks.
Now consider this scenario:
we boot an instance from an image without the os_type property defined and
with an ephemeral disk of 50 G
the resulting backing file will be called ephemeral_50_default.
At this point we take a snapshot from that instance and we boot a new instance
using this snapshot, and because of this bug we will have a new backing file
called ephemeral_50_None.
That is bad becasue is leaking resources in the host.

Please note that I did a small refactor of the code to make my change testable.

Change-Id: I40bca2732ee2c911344e9d361612007da1c7c3cf
Closes-bug: #1240542
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-16 15:27:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "Manage None value for the 'os_type' property

'os_type' property to glance when we are doing a snapshot in the libvirt

with an ephemeral disk of 50 G

At this point we take a snapshot from that instance and we boot a new instance
using this snapshot, and because of this bug we will have a new backing file
called ephemeral_50_None.
That is bad because is leaking resources in the host.

Please note that I did a small refactor of the code to make my change testable.

Change-Id: I40bca2732ee2c911344e9d361612007da1c7c3cf

commit_message:
Manage None value for the 'os_type' property

The I2bab617f6c1e8866650ca7dc5178b640738c9ae6 introduced a way to pass the
'os_type' property to glance when we are doing a snapshot in the libvirt
driver. Currently the code doesn't manage properly the None value for this
property and so None value is passed to glance which creates an image with
a property called 'os_type' with value 'None'.
As results of that all instances booted from a snapshot with this property will
have None value in the os_type field.
That field is used to create file name for backing images for ephemeral disks.
Now consider this scenario:
we boot an instance from an image without the os_type property defined and
with an ephemeral disk of 50 G
the resulting backing file will be called ephemeral_50_default.
At this point we take a snapshot from that instance and we boot a new instance
using this snapshot, and because of this bug we will have a new backing file
called ephemeral_50_None.
That is bad because is leaking resources in the host.

Please note that I did a small refactor of the code to make my change testable.

Change-Id: I40bca2732ee2c911344e9d361612007da1c7c3cf
Closes-bug: #1240542

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-21 22:53:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove package require for cinder-volume

Package 'cinder-volume' is only defined in Debian distros. Leaving it defined breaks RedHat distros.
Since $::cinder::params::ceph_init_override isn't provided by either package, we can remove the require and just rely on the notify to do the required work.

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-21 22:58:20.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/volume/rbd.pp', 'spec/classes/cinder_volume_rbd_spec.rb'], 'message': "Remove package require for cinder-volume

breaks RedHat distros.

Since $::cinder::params::ceph_init_override isn't provided by either package,

", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Remove package require for cinder-volume

Package 'cinder-volume' is only defined in Debian distros. Leaving it defined
breaks RedHat distros.

Since $::cinder::params::ceph_init_override isn't provided by either package,
we can remove the require and just rely on the notify to do the required work.

Change-Id: I51c2a274d0fd6b00f2c4ea7e52e15066c3fd83fc

subject: Do not install pip when OFFLINE=True
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 13:03:26.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'Do not install pip when OFFLINE=True

install_pip.sh trys to fetch pip from the internet even if
OFFLINE=True. It causes stack.sh to fail if the environment
is actually disconnected from the internet. With this patch,
stack.sh skips install_pip.sh if OFFLINE=True.

Change-Id: Ica9e5cfa0a4ee684c05393896c2fd6ddbd9ccd06
Closes-Bug: 1240956
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not install pip when OFFLINE=True

install_pip.sh trys to fetch pip from the internet even if
OFFLINE=True. It causes stack.sh to fail if the environment
is actually disconnected from the internet. With this patch,
stack.sh skips install_pip.sh if OFFLINE=True.

Change-Id: Ica9e5cfa0a4ee684c05393896c2fd6ddbd9ccd06
Closes-Bug: 1240956

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-14 15:26:51.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-docker', 'tools/docker/install_docker.sh'], 'message': "Fix bugs for installing docker, bug #1237581.

   This typo resutls in 'unable to locate the packet' error when executing apt-get.

commit_message:
Fix bugs for installing docker, bug #1237581.
  -The change in install_docker.sh corrects a typo ('=' should be '-').
   This typo resutls in 'unable to locate the packet' error when executing apt-get.

  -The second change is in hypervisor-docker fix the error for reporting
   docker is not installed when docker is actually set up. The original line
   missed the version part of the package name.

Change-Id: Ic48f45158cf84f89080f095d53c355e9f6969bfd

commit_message:
detect failure of 'keystone token-get'

When 'keystone token-get' fails, the caller can't detect the failure.
This cause troulbe shooting a bit complicated.

Closes-Bug: #1238412

commit_message:
Make Object FieldType take an object name instead of a class

The object infrastructure has a concept of an object name, which
is what we use to determine if something implements a particular
thing, and it is how we look up object classes when we
deserialize them. Since many objects will eventually reference
each other, we should be using their names to determine
compatibility, not their classes.

Related to blueprint structured-object-fields

Change-Id: I2edb8b8475662ad25e9f3319ce5e44317a2d0547

commit_message:
Utilizes assertIn - tests/virt

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.
Using assertIn will enhance readability of the test scripts.

Change-Id: Ifa0f7e12a1ba84052e1e64ed2775056fafd2b13b

commit_message:
Fixing possible exception on tables in tabs

When a filter action for instance goes to the server via POST, an
'action' field is not necessarily present in the POST. This results
in an uncaught exception. Fixing this so if 'action' is not present
falling back to old behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1242846

Change-Id: I693fc8174f891cb0e281e5c2810f455b368802ca

commit_message:
Provide gettext _ in missing locations

A while back a change was merged that moved
our shortcut for gettext out of __init__
(change here: If4125d6bcbde63df95de129ac5c83b4a6d6f130a)

This worked out fine for the most part but broke the sphinx doc
builder for a number of files.  This patch just adds the proper
import to each of these files to get the builder working correctly
again.

Change-Id: Ifed20d309566be456c9519294714ccb45de76e00
Closes-Bug: #1209406

commit_message:
Utilizes assertIn - tests/api/contrib

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.
Adapting assertIn will enhance the readability of the test scripts.

Change-Id: Id2237b7a35c5c759e571b138faa8d1bef46a7e27

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-04 05:01:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Utilizes assertIn and assertNotIn - 3/3

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test if an element is in a sequence
is too python2.4. Our unit testing framework supports assertIn and
assertNotIn, included from python 2.7, which were created for these types of
tests. Let's use assertIn or assertNotIn for these tests.

This patch fixes the final 34 files.

Change-Id: Ic3ae0a0eca219bd7d114580ad3642e7df04ad1f4
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-09-24 06:50:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Utilizes assertIn - 1/2

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.

This patch is a mere sed replace of one-liner assertTrues

grep -lR "assert.* in " nova/tests/* | \
xargs sed -ri 's/(\W+self.assert)True(.+) in (.+)(\)$)/\1In\2, \3\4/'

Change-Id: Ic3ae0a0eca219bd7d114580ad3642e7df04ad1f4
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-09-24 08:02:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Utilizes assertIn - 1/2

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.

This patch is a mere sed replace of one-liner assertTrues and some patterns

grep -lR "assert.* in " * | \
xargs sed -ri 's/(\W+self.assert)True(.+) in (.+ for .+ in .+)(\)$)/\1In\2, \3\4/'

grep -lR "assert.* in " * | \
xargs sed -ri 's/(\W+self.assert)True(.+) in (.+)(\)$)/\1In\2, \3\4/'

grep -lR "assertIn(.*,.*,.*)$" * | \
xargs sed -ri 's/(\W+self.assertIn\([^(^[]+,[^(^[]+),.+(\)$)/\1\2/'

Change-Id: Ic3ae0a0eca219bd7d114580ad3642e7df04ad1f4
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2013-09-25 02:03:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Utilizes assertIn - 1/2

grep -lR "assert.* in " * | \
xargs sed -ri 's/(\W+self.assert)True(.+) in (.+)(\)$)/\1In\2, \3\4/'

grep -lR "assertIn(.*,.*,.*)$" * | \
xargs sed -ri 's/(\W+self.assertIn\([^(^[]+,[^(^[]+),.+(\)$)/\1\2/'

Change-Id: Ic3ae0a0eca219bd7d114580ad3642e7df04ad1f4

commit_message:
Utilizes assertIn - tests/api/v3

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.
Using assertIn will enhance readability of the test scripts.

Change-Id: Ic3ae0a0eca219bd7d114580ad3642e7df04ad1f4

subject: Fix tuskar image element config file
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-21 15:14:54.000000000', 'files': ['elements/tuskar/os-config-applier/etc/tuskar/nova_overcloud_config.yml'], 'message': 'Fix tuskar image element config file

Currently, due to limitations of Tuskar, we have to specify
overcloud credentials in its config file. This patch ensures,
that the correct value of keystone host is used.

Change-Id: Ib2ed652cc8f8dec532b4a9cee55be8d1278015f2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix tuskar image element config file

Currently, due to limitations of Tuskar, we have to specify
overcloud credentials in its config file. This patch ensures,
that the correct value of keystone host is used.

Change-Id: Ib2ed652cc8f8dec532b4a9cee55be8d1278015f2

commit_message:
Rewrite dynamicUI to use special metadata client for getting UI defs.

This includes:

* passing request to almost every call of dynamicUI function (for
  Keystone authentication).

* passing SHA-1 hash of current ui definitions package to Metadata
  Repository

* reducing number of import_all_service() calls in dynamic UI (with
  overhead of querying Metadata Repository they are much more costly
  now).

Change-Id: Ifb0e54940779cc0a83f91f6c8d91447c72b60adf

commit_message:
Plug Vif into Midonet using Neutron port binding

Currently Midokura uses its own script (mm-ctl) to bind ports. However, support
for using this script is left out of the nova and neutron projects. This causes
confusion and makes deployments unnecessarily complicated for customers using
Havana. This fix is to change nova to properly use mm-ctl. Corresponding
changes will be submitted to devstack and neutron.

Change-Id: I7c9edded5ab6fe19b63e54cd6905d9242e4a90cc
Closes-Bug: 1235132

commit_message:
hyperv: Initialize target_iqn in attach_volume

The target_iqn is referenced before it is declared in the
case that an exception is encountered in _login_storage_target
or _get_mounted_disk_from_lun.  This causes the exception path
to cause an additional, misleading, traceback to be printed
after an exception is encountered.

This commit initializes target_iqn at the beginning of
attach_volume to avoid the traceback.

Change-Id: I1cdfb9dfa054ee4f4f6918d7bc49081ccaebab9d
Close-Bug: 1233837

subject: Improve logging messages in libvirt driver
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-14 16:51:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Improve logging messages in libvirt driver for instance_disk_info

This is a trivial change to correct an uninformative log message.
There are two checks in get_instance_disk_info that look at a disk.
One checks for the type of a disk and logs its path if it is not a file.
The other checks for the path and logs the instance name it belongs to
if it does not exist. The first will log None if the path does not exist,
so reverse the order of the checks.

Closes-Bug: #1239747
Change-Id: Ieb52ba0584ad789dc55f40e0172cf5ed41e86fbe
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-14 17:31:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': 'Improve logging messages in libvirt driver

This is a trivial change to correct an uninformative log message.
There are two checks in get_instance_disk_info that look at a disk.
One checks for the type of a disk and logs its path if it is not a file.
The other checks for the path and logs the instance name it belongs to
if it does not exist. The first will log None if the path does not exist,
so reverse the order of the checks.

Closes-Bug: #1239747
Change-Id: Ieb52ba0584ad789dc55f40e0172cf5ed41e86fbe
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Improve logging messages in libvirt driver

This is a trivial change to correct an uninformative log message.
There are two checks in get_instance_disk_info that look at a disk.
One checks for the type of a disk and logs its path if it is not a file.
The other checks for the path and logs the instance name it belongs to
if it does not exist. The first will log None if the path does not exist,
so reverse the order of the checks.

Closes-Bug: #1239747
Change-Id: Ieb52ba0584ad789dc55f40e0172cf5ed41e86fbe

commit_message:
Utilizes assertIn - tests/api/etc

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.
Adapting assertIn will enhance the readability of the test scripts.

Change-Id: I9995c6668710e94902d97da21303274965df17e9

commit_message:
Fix pep8 for ostf_adapter

PEP8 fix has been added for ostf_adapter scripts. Fix is incomplete
(especially for E501 "Line is too long") because of meaningless of such
fixing.

Fix unit tests

Several unit tests have been fixed in order to support new discovery
behaviour - new deployment tag which is indicates network manager for
deployment (nova-network or quantum).

Change-Id: Id7b39477e33719695bfcc99173825d75b304c5b3

commit_message:
Fix L2pop to not send updates for unrelated networks

With this patch L2 population mechanism driver
sends updates only with ports related to the
network id of the port which is being updated.

(cherry picked from commit de24799696a8199b13223c2ca3820a9ef015bbe0)
Fixes bug: 1240744

Change-Id: I2cbe69b7d129f5ff8f138650c5aba3c2d2554d75

commit_message:
Use GLANCE_PASS as keystone password

According to
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Conventions#Install_Guide
it should be GLANCE_PASS for keystone, and GLANCE_DBPASS for mysql. The
guide uses GLANCE_DBPASS for both - fix this.

Cherry-Pick: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/53002/
Change-Id: I2db43d383db52bfe50bd988a3b30b848b2d7b1ce
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1242860

commit_message:
Updated Neutron Section

I wish I could say that Neutron Installation section is 100% done,
here is the list of things that need to be finished/completed/considered:

1. Need someone to proof read it once.
2. Add sections for other OpenStack Neutron Plugins, only OVS is
covered over here.
3. Need to review the design of the Networking Section, I think it
can be presented better than it is as of now, as its pretty much
confusing to jump through various modes/types of installation
related to networking section(s).

Backport: stable/havana
Cherry-Picked: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52784/

commit_message:
RS LoadBalancer should return its ID as Ref

Previously the Rackspace::Cloud::LoadBalancer resource returned the name as
its reference ID. This patch reverts this to the default resource behavior
of returning the resource ID if available, and then falling back to the
name. Otherwise there is no way to access the ID of the load balancer,
which is necessary for other Rackspace APIs, such as Rackspace Auto Scale.

Closes-Bug: #1241194
Change-Id: Ib5ca296b338e912daa8c3dc1c71fc3e994a0156e

commit_message:
xenapi: post install scriptlet to rpm

A freshly installed XenServer requires some modifications in order to be
able to run OpenStack. Nova contains an rpm specification to create a
package with the dom0 plugins, however installing the rpm is not enough.
Some more actions need to be taken:
 - create /images, link to a directory within the local SR
 - setup an ssh keypair, and authenticate it with the host
This change adds a post script to the nova plugins rpm spec file, so
by installing the rpm on a XenServer, it is ready to run OpenStack, no
further manual actions needed.

Change-Id: Id57e3a3ab2782550468c6aa4c01059ceb7cc81ab

commit_message:
Fix update interaction in os-services v3 API

Currently update operation doesn't fit with REST or any other nova API-v3 case
since we don't operate over the entity.

With this change we are going to have a service_id on index responses which will
allow us to know the id of the service and make requests to update it using its
id instead of the set binary-host in the body.

Also add unit tests to ensure xml serializers are working fine.

fixes bug #1217026

Change-Id: I933fbe2f88dc64766b8c8d8853c0e7fe290823e4

subject: Add log message to the lockutils synchronised decorator to indicate release
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-14 13:16:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py'], 'message': 'Add log message to the lockutils synchronised decorator to indicate release

The synchronised decorator function has a log message to indicate that a
semaphore has been released, but it is in unreachable code, due to the
wrapped function being returned prior to the message being logged. This
is done because the wrapped function is inside a with block holding the
semaphore lock.

The simplest fix is to put the with block inside a try: statement and
putting the log message inside a corresponding finally: statement.

Change-Id: I06f60dd505dfdfad2e1c9daf0526b4fe0bb56709
Closes-Bug: #1239679
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add log message to the lockutils synchronised decorator to indicate release

The synchronised decorator function has a log message to indicate that a
semaphore has been released, but it is in unreachable code, due to the
wrapped function being returned prior to the message being logged. This
is done because the wrapped function is inside a with block holding the
semaphore lock.

The simplest fix is to put the with block inside a try: statement and
putting the log message inside a corresponding finally: statement.

Change-Id: I06f60dd505dfdfad2e1c9daf0526b4fe0bb56709
Closes-Bug: #1239679

commit_message:
WIP: Update service record immediately once service restart

When using db driver or mc driver for servicegroup, if the service
was created before and restart, then the service record will not
be updated immediately but need to wait a delay_interval
(10s by default) before update.

This will cause VM deploy failed when nova compute restart and user
deploy VM immediately with ComputeFilter.

Change-Id: I62392748bae57ac35718cc2ad5d4c4d1b985fbcd
Closes-Bug: #1226370

commit_message:
Add extend_volume for Huawei drivers

This patch adds extend_volume function for Huawei drivers.

Huawei T driver needs to create a slave LUN for the extended LUN.
And accordingly it needs to delete all these slave LUNs before deleting
the extended LUN.

HVS driver just sends a rest command to finish extending volume.

Change-Id: Iae17dba8c4d88ec09eb52b4a14bd17bc5a2c1ccc

subject: Make test_translations test our tree
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-05 05:22:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make test_translations test our tree

In order to run the correct classes, Python test framework adjusts
sys.path. However, these changes are not propagated to subprocesses.
Therefore, the test actually tries to test installed Swift, not
the one in which it is running.

The usual suggestion is to run "python swift.py develop" before
testing, but it's annoying and error-prone. It's a good thing if
your tests blow up with "cannot import '_'" rather than silently
succeeding in testing the installed, but it's not guaranteed.

Let's just pass the correct path to subprocess. Much safer.

Change-Id: Ic71314e8462cf6e0579d704ffe9fbbfac7e6ba24
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-05 05:24:38.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/locale/test_locale.py'], 'message': 'Make test_translations test our tree

In order to run the correct classes, Python test framework adjusts
sys.path. However, these changes are not propagated to subprocesses.
Therefore, the test actually tries to test installed Swift, not
the one in which it is running.

The usual suggestion is to run "python setup.py develop" before
testing, but it's annoying and error-prone. If you forget it,
you may test the code in /usr very easily, and never know.

Let's just pass the correct path to subprocess. Much safer.

Change-Id: Ic71314e8462cf6e0579d704ffe9fbbfac7e6ba24
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Make test_translations test our tree

In order to run the correct classes, Python test framework adjusts
sys.path. However, these changes are not propagated to subprocesses.
Therefore, the test actually tries to test installed Swift, not
the one in which it is running.

The usual suggestion is to run "python setup.py develop" before
testing, but it's annoying and error-prone. If you forget it,
you may test the code in /usr very easily, and never know.

Let's just pass the correct path to subprocess. Much safer.

Change-Id: Ic71314e8462cf6e0579d704ffe9fbbfac7e6ba24

subject: Small efficiency improvement in account quotas
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 19:36:58.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/account_quotas.py'], 'message': 'Small efficiency improvement in account quotas

If you were performing an object PUT with X-Copy-From and you had
account_quotas in your pipeline but your account did not have a quota
set, then we will now avoid an unnecessary call to get_object_info().

Change-Id: I8592d4ad65e45ecf9e0557bc10ce2c2db19732e8
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Small efficiency improvement in account quotas

If you were performing an object PUT with X-Copy-From and you had
account_quotas in your pipeline but your account did not have a quota
set, then we will now avoid an unnecessary call to get_object_info().

Change-Id: I8592d4ad65e45ecf9e0557bc10ce2c2db19732e8

commit_message:
Bugfix the swift-ring-builder output scanner

The ring output scanner uses the output of the swift-ring-builder
to determine which disks are new and which have already been added
to the swift ring.  The output is slightly different in grizzly
and thus the new format needed to be handled here.

Fixes LP#1240634

Change-Id: I6788da8746d9572777b025722c3a9e74fdb946a1

commit_message:
Uses oslo.imageutils

Commit 035668 had the QemuImgInfo class moved to Oslo.
This class diverged from Nova and then missed some changes
made in Nova since then. The two projects will be able to use
identical classes by adapting imageutils.

Change-Id: I6ed352c42e45d32de94066c82f83e7332d4a98ed

commit_message:
Add auth_token settings to cinder.conf.sample.

Updates our example config file so that it includes configuration
settings for the auth_token middleware.

A step towards using cinder.conf instead of the api-paste.ini config file
for authtoken configuration.

Once https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52259/ lands I'll push another
review which removes the settings from api-paste.ini (which takes priority).

Related-Bug #1240753

Change-Id: I6636d33ee522757145ac97fc354324a8b9379700

to entry point 'nova.api.v3.extensions' and
'nova.api.v3.extensions.server.create*/rebuild*/update' in setup.cfg.

commit_message:
Add extension access_ips for v3 API

The functionality of access ips overlaps heavily with floating ips,
and the most deployments don't use access ips now. So we decided to
demote access_ips to extensions, the more detail discussion at:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/NovaV3APICore

New extension add prefix 'os-access-ips' for properties 'access_ip_v4' and
'access_ip_v6' to follow v3 API rules. And add unittest for new extension.

For making this patch small, this patch just add the code of extension
and related unittest, without enable the new extension and remove the
old access_ips attributes. That will be done by next patch.

If you want to test this new extension, you can enable it by adding
'access_ips = nova.api.openstack.compute.plugins.v3.access_ips:AccessIPs'
to entry point 'nova.api.v3.extensions' and
'nova.api.v3.extensions.server.create*/rebuild*/update' in setup.cfg.

DocImpact

Partially implements bp nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ib56e4ff9145798792f062fc107390565673ac9a1

commit_message:
Add check for comparsion operator/methods to None

PEP8 states that comparisons to singletons like None
should always be done with is or is not, never the equality operators.
Therefore asserting that a variable is None should not be done
using assertTrue or assertEquals.

Change-Id: I2508da443f5e19e51cf7819c82ae2350e5593d2d

commit_message:
Transform the for loop to expression

In python 3, if the dict is changed in the loop, there will
be following error:
RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration

Transform the "for loop" to expression to avoid it:
- Use dict() to keep capatibility for old Python version.
- six.iteritems() to avoid the following error:
  ValueError: too many values to unpack

Finally, _code_map contains all the classes that have http_status
attribute.

Close-Bug #1240725

Change-Id: I169b13546bcd0d87353dbca5a9b64229b704fe66

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2013-07-05 21:26:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Define a public DiskFile API (work-in-progress)

Define an officially supported API of the DiskFile class. All methods
and attributes are separated into public and private name spaces (see
PEP8, using single leading underscore instead of double underscore to
avoid name obfuscation) and documented as such.

Refactor on-disk knowledge out of the object server by pushing the
async update pickle creation to the new DiskFileManager class (name is
not the best, so suggestions welcome), along with the REPLICATOR
method logic. We also move the mount checking and thread pool storage
to the new ondisk.Devices object, which then also becomes the new home
of the audit_location_generator method.

For the object server, a new setup() method is now called at the end
of the controller's construction, and the _diskfile() method has been
renamed to get_diskfile(), to allow implementation specific behavior.

We then hide the need for the REST API layer to know how and where
quarantining needs to be performed. There are now two places it is
checked internally, on open() where we verify the content-length,
name, and x-timestamp metadata, and in the reader on close where the
etag metadata is checked if the entire file was read.

We add a reader class to allow implementations to isolate the WSGI
handling code for that specific environment (it is used no-where else
in the REST APIs). This simplifies the caller's code to just use a
"with" statement once open to avoid multiple points where close needs
to be called.

For a full historical comparison, including the usage patterns see:
https://gist.github.com/portante/5488238

commit_message:
DiskFile API, with reference implementation

Refactor on-disk knowledge out of the object server by pushing the
async update pickle creation to the new DiskFileManager class (name is
not the best, so suggestions welcome), along with the REPLICATOR
method logic. We also move the mount checking and thread pool storage
to the new ondisk.Devices object, which then also becomes the new home
of the audit_location_generator method.

For the object server, a new setup() method is now called at the end
of the controller's construction, and the _diskfile() method has been
renamed to get_diskfile(), to allow implementation specific behavior.

We then hide the need for the REST API layer to know how and where
quarantining needs to be performed. There are now two places it is
checked internally, on open() where we verify the content-length,
name, and x-timestamp metadata, and in the reader on close where the
etag metadata is checked if the entire file was read.

We add a reader class to allow implementations to isolate the WSGI
handling code for that specific environment (it is used no-where else
in the REST APIs). This simplifies the caller's code to just use a
"with" statement once open to avoid multiple points where close needs
to be called.

For a full historical comparison, including the usage patterns see:
https://gist.github.com/portante/5488238

(as of master, 2b639f5, Merge
 "Fix 500 from account-quota     This Commit
 middleware")
--------------------------------+------------------------------------
                                 DiskFileManager(conf)

                                   Methods:
                                     .pickle_async_update()
                                     .get_diskfile()
                                     .get_hashes()

                                   Attributes:
                                     .devices
                                     .logger
                                     .disk_chunk_size
                                     .keep_cache_size
                                     .bytes_per_sync

DiskFile(a,c,o,keep_data_fp=)    DiskFile(a,c,o)

  Methods:                         Methods:
   *.__iter__()
    .close(verify_file=)
    .is_deleted()
    .is_expired()
    .quarantine()
    .get_data_file_size()
                                     .open()
                                     .read_metadata()
    .create()                        .create()
                                     .write_metadata()
    .delete()                        .delete()

  Attributes:                      Attributes:
    .quarantined_dir
    .keep_cache
    .metadata
                                *DiskFileReader()

                                   Methods:
                                     .__iter__()
                                     .close()

                                   Attributes:
                                    +.was_quarantined

DiskWriter()                     DiskFileWriter()

  Methods:                         Methods:
    .write()                         .write()
    .put()                           .put()

* Note that the DiskFile class   * Note that the DiskReader() object
  implements all the methods       returned by the
  necessary for a WSGI app         DiskFileOpened.reader() method
  iterator                         implements all the methods
                                   necessary for a WSGI app iterator

                                 + Note that if the auditor is
                                   refactored to not use the DiskFile
                                   class, see
                                   https://review.openstack.org/44787
                                   then we don't need the
                                   was_quarantined attribute

A reference "in-memory" object server implementation of a backend
DiskFile class in swift/obj/mem_server.py and
swift/obj/mem_diskfile.py.

One can also reference
https://github.com/portante/gluster-swift/commits/diskfile for the
proposed integration with the gluster-swift code based on these
changes.

Change-Id: I44e153fdb405a5743e9c05349008f94136764916
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Security groups workflow update

Changes: Creating new Instance Task Status for Security groups
         Updating statuses if exception happend.

If security groups quota exceeded trove-api falls into exception
with updating instance task and service task statuses
to inform user that exception happend while security groups creation

Moving secgroup provision logic to the task manager

Author: Steve Leon <steve.leon@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Denis M <dmakogon@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I74def4a4489951139ce8462104f1d7987c4f2fca
Implements: blueprint security-groups-workflow-update

subject: Proxy: use just one greenthread per client
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-15 15:47:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Proxy: use just one greenthread per client

Instead of using two greenthreads and an eventlet.queue.Queue of size
1 to stream response bodies from backends to clients, just do it with
a single greenthread that reads and writes in a loop. This should
lower the amount of CPU used by the proxy in its response streaming.

Client fairness used to be provided implicitly; since the queue only
held 1 item, the read-from-backend greenthread would block after each
chunk until the write-to-client greenthread got a chance to run. Now
fairness is provided by an explicit eventlet.sleep() call, just as it
is in the object server.

Change-Id: Iae27109f5a3d109ad21ec9a972e39f22150f6dbb
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-16 19:45:37.000000000', 'files': ['swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': 'Proxy: use just one greenthread per client

Instead of using two greenthreads and an eventlet.queue.Queue of size
1 to stream response bodies from backends to clients, just do it with
a single greenthread that reads and writes in a loop. This should
lower the amount of CPU used by the proxy in its response streaming.

Client fairness used to be provided implicitly; since the queue only
held 1 item, the read-from-backend greenthread would block after each
chunk until the write-to-client greenthread got a chance to run. Now
fairness is provided by an explicit eventlet.sleep() call, just as it
is in the object server.

Change-Id: Iae27109f5a3d109ad21ec9a972e39f22150f6dbb
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Proxy: use just one greenthread per client

Instead of using two greenthreads and an eventlet.queue.Queue of size
1 to stream response bodies from backends to clients, just do it with
a single greenthread that reads and writes in a loop. This should
lower the amount of CPU used by the proxy in its response streaming.

Client fairness used to be provided implicitly; since the queue only
held 1 item, the read-from-backend greenthread would block after each
chunk until the write-to-client greenthread got a chance to run. Now
fairness is provided by an explicit eventlet.sleep() call, just as it
is in the object server.

Change-Id: Iae27109f5a3d109ad21ec9a972e39f22150f6dbb

commit_message:
Introduce support for persistent state in /mnt.

Since instances that have ephemeral volumes, which we plan to use for
persistent state (yes the name is confusing) start with the volume
empty, we need some support to aid in placing state files (and
configuration files we want to generate dynamically) on that partition
- we can't just move stuff there during build, or it will be mounted
over by cloud-init.

Change-Id: Iff9e329ba6217e5f7290b7ab65b1808f4a8d8f9a

commit_message:
Add support to disable resources

To remove a resource, you add the following to the global environment:

resource_registry:
  'AWS::*':

implements blueprint exclude-resources-option

Change-Id: Ia7c6c78ad3c1850ea20dd942d8d52957b5ad2b11
